characters: TEAR IN HIS BLUE EYES/ AS YOUNG
WHEN THE SOLDIERS CAME A KNOCKING,
PROMISED TO BE TRUE. I WENT TO
THE HOT SOUTH AMERICAN WOMAN STARES AT ALLEN FOR A BEAT,
RODDY MCCORLEY GOES TO DIE/ ON THE
THROUGH THE RED LIGHT SMASHING INTO A DOUBLE DECKER
TESS LAID THERE, NOT LETTING GO OF
DROP DEAD. FOR FIVE DAYS YOUNG
WE PULL OUT OF THE PRESS CONFERENCE
WAR TO COME BACK AND FIND FIVE
TAKE FROM US AND HER MOTHER DID
A HEMP-ROPE ON HIS NECK/ NE'ER A
TERRY IMMEDIATELY ROLLS AND POPS UP ON A KNEE, GUN DRAWN
FREEZE ON THE EXPLOSION OF TRUMP MARINA. WE CUT TO
I PLEDGE MY LOVE TO ERIN, SHE
RIDE A PAINTED PONEY LET THE
AND THEN THE BODIES BURIED THERE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s a perfect day in New York - blue skies and sunshine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a few customers are in the bank as it nears closing time: A WOMAN WEARING SUNGLASSES WITH A BABY STROLLER steps up to the teller.

dialogues.speaker: TELLER
dialogues.text: Hello there. What’s this little one’s name? The woman reaches down and pulls a blanket off the stroller. The two other customers reach in and pull out SLICK SEMI AUTOMATIC RIFLES.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN WITH GUNS
dialogues.text: (thick German accent) The baby’s name is push the alarm and you will have a giant bloody hole in your chest!

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC
dialogues.text: The woman takes off a wig, REVEALING a man. ALL THREE ROBBERS LOOK IDENTICAL: blonde, baseball caps, blonde moustaches, sunglasses.

dialogues.speaker: BANK ROBBER 1
dialogues.text: (also with German accent) Everybody relax. I want no heroes! If you notice I have a Germanic accent, from the Rhine region. Something distinct to tell the authorities. The Security Guard raises his arms submissively.

dialogues.speaker: BANK ROBBER 3
dialogues.text: Three more minutes! BARRY, the assistant manager, walks over and opens the door for Bank Robbers 1 and 2 while Bank Robber 3 keeps a gun on the employees and a few customers.

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: This way!

dialogues.speaker: TELLER
dialogues.text: Barry, what are you doing? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: I have to. My daughter’s going to Tulane. I want a plasma. IT’S

dialogues.speaker: CALLED LIVING
dialogues.text: Barry leads Bank Robber 1 and 2 to the vault.

dialogues.speaker: BANK ROBBER 3
dialogues.text: One hundred forty seconds!

dialogues.speaker: BANK ROBBER 2
dialogues.text: (in German) There’s no money in the vault! Just these notes!!

dialogues.speaker: BANK ROBBER 1
dialogues.text: Barry, there was supposed to be two million in cash! What the shit is going on!!!

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: (fast nervous description) Well see, the Fed just came and seized all our cash and reserve deposits. Right before that happened, the bank put all of its outstanding mortgages into four tranches, which was snapped up by China, which is a good thing. Cash infusion, right? Wrong, sixty percent of debt was toxic. Cash from China isn’t coming in and now we’ve had to issue Promissory Notes to cover all reserves on deposit. But I assure you, in four years you’re looking at six hundred thousand dollars, a nice tidy sum. Bank Robber #3 holds up a bag.

dialogues.speaker: BANK ROBBER 3
dialogues.text: I got eight thousand from the drawers! Let’s go! All three Bank Robbers start to back out of the bank. Barry follows.

dialogues.speaker: BANK ROBBER 1
dialogues.text: (turns and points gun) And Barry, just to guarantee that no one talks. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: I asked you a dozen times if you were going to kill me after the robbery and you said no.

dialogues.speaker: BANK ROBBER 1
dialogues.text: I lied.

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: I even asked you if you would say “I lied” if I asked you why you were going to kill me after- He shoots Barry. Barry's lifeless body falls against a sign advertising low, low mortgage rates. SFX: Alarms sound. EXT. BANK — CONTINUOUS The “Germans” run out and into a waiting car -- a late modeled Mercedes Benz -- and speed off. Cop cars follow in the distance. INT. MERCEDES —- CONTINUOUS Off come the sunglasses and wigs revealing three CHINESE GUYS.

dialogues.speaker: BANK ROBBER 1
dialogues.text: (Mandarin accent) Eight thousand dollars! That robbery didn’t even pay for itself!

dialogues.speaker: BANK ROBBER 2
dialogues.text: (thick German accent) At least with our German accents they will never be able to identify us!

dialogues.speaker: BANK ROBBER 1
dialogues.text: Stop with the accent! It’s annoying.

dialogues.speaker: BANK ROBBER 2
dialogues.text: (Cantonese accent now as well) Sorry. It was hard to master and I am proud of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP: wide angle lens shot of a big fat American made tire and fender coming into frame. MAN’S VOICE I’m just saying a pinch of sugar cuts the acidity of the tomatoes. We go inside the car to find DANSON AND MANZETTI -- iconic star cops (think Stallone, Willis, Jackson etc). Manzetti is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: DANSON
dialogues.text: Sometimes I put two pinches....

dialogues.speaker: MANZETTI
dialogues.text: No! Don’t put two pinches! (and then to Danson) Stop it! My wife gets confused in the kitchen. She’s gonna wreck the sauce. A call comes over the radio.

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We've got a ten thirty in progress. Three German males, driving a white, late model Mercedes. South on 6th Avenue. Manzetti puts a magnetic light on the roof, Danson guns the engine.

dialogues.speaker: DANSON
dialogues.text: Time to get our hair mussed up. Danson hits the tape deck. MUSIC: ERIC B AND RAKIM’S “FOLLOW THE LEADER” KICKS IN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danson floors it then cuts the wheel and drives through a park. We see the cop cars and the Mercedes speeding through traffic and DANSON AND MANZETTI POWER INTO THE CHASE overtaking the squad cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chinese guys listen to a scanner.

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I repeat- a 2003 white Mercedes 300 with three German males...

dialogues.speaker: BANK ROBBER 2
dialogues.text: (German accent) Our plan is exceeding expectations.

dialogues.speaker: BANK ROBBER 3
dialogues.text: Seriously stop it. They hit the brakes and skid to a stop around a corner behind a delivery truck as the cop cars pass. EXT. STREET —- DAY Two guys jump out and with surgical precision THEY PULL WHITE “SKINS” OFF THE CAR, REVEALING A SILVER NISSAN 300ZX. One rips off the Mercedes hood ornament and slaps on a Nissan one. In the back, the other snaps on a spoiler. They jump back in and punch it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see two POLICE OFFICERS in their car. They can’t find them.

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Anyone have a read on the Mercedes? Anyone.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: It’s like they disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danson and Manzetti sit at the red light.

dialogues.speaker: MANZETTI
dialogues.text: (into phone) Now just stir it on a low flame...Make sure it simmers. You don’t want a full boil. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danson looks across at the Nissan next to him. He sees three Chinese guys trying to look relaxed. Danson looks closer. We see what he’s looking at. REVEAL: A MERCEDES HUB CAP. Danson rolls his window all the way down.

dialogues.speaker: DANSON
dialogues.text: Hey fellas, Sprechen zie Mandarin? The Chinese guys realize they’ve been made. THEY PUNCH IT

dialogues.speaker: TOURIST BUS.
dialogues.text: Danson and Manzetti almost get hit by the toppling bus and cut around the corner. QUICK CUT: Body Shop Bill uncrumples in frame while action freezes: “Double Deck Tour Bus....43,450 dollars in damages.” UNFREEZE AND BACK TO ACTION.

dialogues.speaker: MANZETTI
dialogues.text: (still on phone) Just keep stirring sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC: FOLLOW THE LEADER kicks back in. The two cars battle for space as they fly up Park Avenue. We see STORE FRONTS WITH FOR LEASE signs in the windows. INT. DANSON AND MANZETTI’S CAR - CONTINUOUS POV of DANSON as they drive to the divider on Park Ave. The Chinese bump Danson’s car. Danson drives up the ramp, the Chinese down below. THEY'VE LOST THEM. We see in front of him the entrance to a building.

dialogues.speaker: MANZETTI
dialogues.text: Are you thinking what I’m thinking? CRASH! Danson drives through the windowed doors and into the office building which towers over 42nd street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They’re on the second floor of an office. They drive down the corridor, taking cubicles with them as people dive for cover.

dialogues.speaker: DANSON
dialogues.text: Stop playing mine sweeper! Get back to work! They smash through the cubicle where an OFFICE WORKER is playing mine sweeper and we FREEZE AND THEN FLASH CUT TO: TWO WEEKS LATER: A MAINTENANCE MAN finishes fixing the cubicle.

dialogues.speaker: MAINTENANCE MAN
dialogues.text: There you go, all set. We see the same OFFICE WORKER still playing mine sweeper. He doesn’t even look up.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICE WORKER
dialogues.text: Thanks. UNFREEZE and BACK TO ACTION. The car smashes through a giant window and BOUNCES DOWN THE STAIRS separating two escalators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car crashes through the glass and onto 42nd street.

dialogues.speaker: MANZETTI
dialogues.text: (into phone) Just add a splash of red table wine. Not the expensive kind!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robber 1 looks in the rear view mirror and sees Danson and Manzetti pull in behind them.

dialogues.speaker: BANK ROBBER 2
dialogues.text: Mein Gott!! INT. DANSON AND MANZETTI’S CAR - DAY Manzetti reaches behind the car seat and brandishes a large fifty caliber rifle. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DANSON
dialogues.text: How'd you get that?

dialogues.speaker: MANZETTI
dialogues.text: I used a coupon. Danson laughs. He’s having a good time. Manzetti fires the 50 cal at the Chinese. It’s like a cannon.

dialogues.speaker: SFX
dialogues.text: The Chinese fire back with 38’s. Danson and Manzetti HIT THEIR BRAKES HARD, screeching to a stop at an intersection. An OLD LADY PUSHES A GUY IN A WHEELCHAIR WHO’S PUSHING A BABY STROLLER through the intersection while all traffic waits. They watch the Chinese speed off in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: DANSON
dialogues.text: (re: wheel chair/stroller) Amazing, all the years driving the streets and I’ve never seen that before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sign read BEAST TOURIST SPEED BOATS: “All of Manhattan in twenty minutes.” All three Chinese run and jump on to the boat. Tourists jump off at gunpoint. THE CHINESE GUN THE BOAT TOWARDS THE STATUE OF LIBERTY AND FREEDOM. Danson and Manzetti pull up, seconds too late.

dialogues.speaker: MANZETTI
dialogues.text: (hanging up the phone) Bad news. She wrecked the sauce. Manzetti hangs up as they watch the boat head out of the harbor.

dialogues.speaker: DANSON
dialogues.text: Are you thinking what I’m thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Beast flies across the water. In the distance is a waiting Tanker with a Zodiac raft next to it. Robber 1 points the nose in that direction. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ROBBER 1
dialogues.text: A tanker? How much did this robbery cost?

dialogues.speaker: ROBBER 2
dialogues.text: We're going to have to get real jobs to pay this off. Just then, the sound of their boat is drowned out by a thunderous noise.

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC
dialogues.text: Hovering right over them is a HELICOPTER flown by Danson and Manzetti. They smile. Over a PA we hear.

dialogues.speaker: MANZETTI
dialogues.text: Time to clean the garbage outta the Hudson! Danson zeroes the helicopter in on the Beast. Closer and closer. HE GENTLY USES THE HELICOPTER SKIDS AND PICKS THE BEAST UP, lifting it out of the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tourists line up on the bow of a Circle Line Boat and take pictures of the skyline. A MIDDLE AGED MAN TOURIST is there with his wife.

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE AGED MAN TOURIST
dialogues.text: I’m telling you, New York City has lost it’s edge. It’s not what it used to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chinese climb toward the rails of the helicopter. One starts to shoot at Danson and Manzetti. A bullet hits the skids.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON THE SKIDS
dialogues.text: FEET TO THE WATER and CRASHES into the water. Unmanned and still full throttle, it snakes it’s way toward a giant sign: “Coming Soon Trump Marina!”. THE BEAST CRASHES INTO IT WITH A GIANT, FIERY EXPLOSION. The Circle Line passengers watch.

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE AGED MAN TOURIST
dialogues.text: That’s kind of cool. I guess. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FREEZE ON THE EXPLOSION OF TRUMP MARINA. WE CUT TO
dialogues.text: Donald Trump on the set of THE APPRENTICE 8.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD TRUMP
dialogues.text: And the winner of Apprentice 8 will spearhead the rebuilding of my marina.

dialogues.speaker: UNFREEZE AND BACK TO ACTION
dialogues.text: EXT. RIKER’S ISLAND - DAY The helicopter lowers the three Chinese into the yard. Inmates cheer.

dialogues.speaker: INMATES
dialogues.text: Hey! It’s Danson and Manzetti!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge crowd of reporters is in front of Danson and Manzetti who are fielding questions with the Chief of Police, the Mayor and the D.A. behind them.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: New York Post Online. Were you guys at all concerned about your safety?

dialogues.speaker: DANSON
dialogues.text: You know what I say, you can always take a Motrin later. Huge laughs from the press pool. Reporter #1 wipes a tear away and jots down the “quote”.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: New York Times Online. Is it true that after forty-six million dollars in property damage that the robbers were caught with only eight thousand dollars? Silence. More silence.

dialogues.speaker: MANZETTI
dialogues.text: Looks like someone didn’t have their morning coffee. Huge laughs from all the other reporters.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: You guys are the best! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Entertainment Weekly Online. Danson, Manzetti, how is your department handling the current budget cuts and lay offs to the the force?

dialogues.speaker: MANZETTI
dialogues.text: So long as we got enough to buy bones for ol’ Arnold here. Manzetti’s BULLDOG barks, CAMERAS FLASH, medals are pinned on by the Mayor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danson and Manzetti enter the Precinct. Everyone cheers. Danson holds up the medal

dialogues.speaker: DANSON
dialogues.text: (holds up paper) This is for all of us!

dialogues.speaker: MANZETTI
dialogues.text: Even though it specifically just says our names on it. A lot more applause. CAMERAS FLASH -- We PAN OVER through the crowd to ALLEN GAMBLE (Will Ferrell). He snaps another photo. His partner TERRY HOITZ (Mark Wahlberg) slaps the camera down.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Stop it man.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: DANSON
dialogues.text: We're going to celebrate at Butter tonight. Deejay Skeleton Penis is going to be spinning.

dialogues.speaker: MANZETTI
dialogues.text: We got Brody Jenner, Bai Lynn, some kids from Road Rules. Anyway, you’re all on the list! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Danson and Manzetti head out as LIEUTENANT MAUCH, 55, gives them a wave.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: Nice work today Detectives! (then to the others) Now we got Chinese nationals with no paperwork -- INS nightmare, fifty million in property damage. This paperwork is going to be thicker than the Bejing phone book. Who wants to be a hero?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: (very loudly, enthusiastically) I do! (then) Debbie! I’m going to need a new mouse pad! Two boxes of Uni-Balls micro tip in blue! Terry watches Allen grab the stuff. We meet SCOTT MARTIN and RICK FOSSE - Martin and Fosse - two detectives, cool, connected and ready to be heroes.

dialogues.speaker: FOSSE
dialogues.text: Alright! “Spell Check” is on the case!

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: “Spell Check” and “Hero” pulling up on the rear! All the cops laugh. Terry walks over to Allen who is typing with a big smile on his face.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Jesus, look at that big smile on your face.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Until there’s a piece of paper with the word guilty on it justice can not be served. Paperwork is the oxygen Justice breathes. So feel free to make fun of me all you want behind my back.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: If I’m going to say something, I’ll say it to your face. I don’t like you. Not like “I don’t like onions.” I mean I don’t like you on a muscular, raw smell level. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If we were in the wild, I would attack you. Even if you weren’t in my food chain, I would go out of my way to attack you. If I were a lion, and you were a tuna, I would swim out and eat you.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: There’s a reason people talk behind each other’s backs! At least pay me that courtesy! DETECTIVE BOB DELANEY (Mike Delaney) pokes his head in to the conversation, holding a mug of coffee. He’s an affable and pleasant guy.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Hey guys, you see American Idol last night? I can’t believe that girl won! I mean, wow! She’s a cutie.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: It’s a bad time Bob!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A UNSEEN FIGURE watches a MONITOR. On it is DAVID

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON, 40
dialogues.text: setting. s, suave, being interviewed in a Bahamas type

dialogues.speaker: DAVID ERSHON
dialogues.text: (English accent) How does it feel being a billionaire? Yesterday I kite surfed with a nude super model on my back. The day before I gota six handed hand job from triplets...Can I say that on TV?

dialogues.speaker: LESLIE STAHL
dialogues.text: You own thirty percent of the network. You can say whatever you want.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID ERSHON
dialogues.text: (chuckling) That’s right, I do. How does it feel to be a billionaire?...Stellar. The Unseen Figure repeatedly rewinds it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DAVID ERSHON (CONT’D) ..-Stellar... Stellar... Stellar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SIGN READS: “9AM: GRIEF AND RELIEF COUNSELING - NYPD”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A THERAPY GROUP of police sits in a circle. One man, the THERAPIST holds a clip board. A VETERAN COP shares. Hoitz sits in the center, listening.

dialogues.speaker: VETERAN COP
dialogues.text: A brown tar heroin bust has gotten sticky. Buddy and I hightail it down to Chinatown. Ugly misty night. Sleeting, but sticking. We split up and turn the corner and I’m looking at four members of the Crazy Eye’d Dragons. Other cops murmur -- “nasty”, “oh shit, I know where this is heading”, “why’d you split up, you never split up!”

dialogues.speaker: THERAPIST
dialogues.text: Shhh. This isn’t about judgement, this about dealing with the pain of using your gun in the line of duty. Please go on...

dialogues.speaker: VETERAN COP
dialogues.text: Anyway, three I pegged as scared, I'll hold off. I spotted the one with the even hand. I get the drop on him, pop off two rounds on a roll putting red carnations on his chest like he’s going to the frickin prom. Now standing and acting this out.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER COPS
dialogues.text: Yea! Pop! Pop!

dialogues.speaker: VETERAN COP
dialogues.text: I hit two more in the knees and raise up to take out the leader and just then my gun jams. Click, click. I’m a dead man. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: OTHER COPS
dialogues.text: Oh shit!

dialogues.speaker: VETERAN COP
dialogues.text: I hear a whistle. Look up and it’s my partner tucked away on a roof. He says, “let’s even the odds” and drops me down a Mosberg pump, clip action, matte black, nice. I send one right through the bag of H he’s holding and into his chest. Game over. All the cops applaud and cheer.

dialogues.speaker: THERAPIST
dialogues.text: Okay, this is supposed to be about your feelings after using your weapon to harm another human... How did you feel after this?

dialogues.speaker: VETERAN COP
dialogues.text: I got a medal and a thousand pats on the back. So how’d I feel? Like a rhino with a badge and a hard- on. Cops all cheer.

dialogues.speaker: THERAPIST
dialogues.text: Stop!! We're supposed to be expressing grief we bury inside ourselves after a traumatic experience. Okay, Officer Hoitz? Everyone looks at him, stares him down.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Why’s he even in here?!

dialogues.speaker: THERAPIST
dialogues.text: He’s in here because this is a place where we can share without judgement. Terry?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Okay. I, uh, I relive it every night. Bronx, October. Game seven of the World Series. You guys know the drill. High pressure, unruly crowds and I pull tunnel duty. We see this unfold. 15.  16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry in cop uniform is guarding a tunnel. A shadowy figure is walking towards him.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I saw a shadowy figure in the tunnel. I told’em to stop. Over and over. Finally I pulled my gun. We see Terry screaming “Stop!” Terry pulls his gun. The shadowy figure has a baseball bat.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And he pulls a deadly weapon and starts running at me.

dialogues.speaker: COPS
dialogues.text: It’s called a bat! Come on!

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I didn’t know! I warned him again and then I shot. We see TERRY RUN TO THE FIGURE HE SHOT IN THE LEG. As he bends down, the lights in the tunnel brighten and we see it’s DEREK JETER. Derek is wearing an iPod. cop #2 (V.0.) You shot Jeter!

dialogues.speaker: DEREK JETER
dialogues.text: My leg! You shot me in my leg!

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO REAL TIME
dialogues.text: Everyone stares at Terry with such disdain.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: He was wearing in iPod! He couldn't hear me!! Jose Vizcaino replaces him and goes O for five, Yankees lose the World Series. I relive it every day.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: So do I. I lost ten grand on that game cause of you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I was top of my class, number one in marksmanship in the city, number three Hapkaido and now I do paper work. CoP #4 Jerk off!

dialogues.speaker: THERAPIST
dialogues.text: Listen, Terry messed up. He did an incredibly dumb and hurtful thing that no other cop would ever do and his career will continue to suffer for the rest of his life. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: But?

dialogues.speaker: THERAPIST
dialogues.text: But what?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Are you going to say something about moving on and healing?

dialogues.speaker: THERAPIST
dialogues.text: No. I finished my statement. I had box seats for that game. Officer Tranton? cop #4 stands up and starts waxing the story.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Okay so I’m undercover on a white slavery case against the Russian mob... Some of the police reveal popcorn.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Oooh, this is a good one. INT. D.A.’S SPECIAL UNIT OFFICES - SAME TIME The office is bustling with early morning activity. Allen is deep in paperwork. Martin and Fosse come and sit on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: FOSSE
dialogues.text: Hey Allen, how’s that paperwork going? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Great. I’ve seen a real increase in illegalities in construction permits, specifically scaffolding. I'd call it a crime wave actually.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: That’s real interesting. Hey how come you’ve never fired your weapon in the office?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Who fires their weapon in the office?

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: We all have.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: That seems a little dangerous and maybe against the rules.

dialogues.speaker: FOSSE
dialogues.text: Rules? Dangerous? We’re cops. The gun is a tool of our trade. It’s okay to use your tool. This is a professional environment.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: You really think we’d lie to you about firing your weapon in the office? It’s called a Desk Pop. It’s a tradition in the force.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Yes, really. Take your gun out. Allen tentatively pulls his gun out.

dialogues.speaker: FOSSE
dialogues.text: Pop one off!

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I don’t know. This feels wrong.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Wrong? We’re cops. This is what we do. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There’s no safer place in the world to fire off a round than in the station.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Wow, now I’m kind of excited. I’m going to do it. Wait, let me ask the Lieutenant --- nah, nevermind I’m just going to do it. (aiming) Up or down?

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN FOSSE
dialogues.text: Up. Down. ALLEN (CONT’D) Boy, I don’t know guys.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: You're over thinking it! Just do it! 19. Allen fires straight up into the ceiling. Sheetrock panels fall down and dust. Immediately all the cops pull out their guns. Some guys hit the floor. SFX: ALARM goes off in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: It’s okay! Desk pop! First ever desk pop! Fosse and Martin are laughing. Terry runs in, gun drawn.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: (talking loud from ears ringing) I did my first ever desk pop! It’s a real thing, right? Right?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: A desk pop?!! No that’s not real!!

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I thought so but then they made it seem real...!! SMASH CUT TO THE LIEUTENANT’S OFFICE (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Allen and Terry are seated on a couch talking to the Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: Allen, you’re going to need to hand over your gun.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Really? Lieutenant Mauch reaches into a drawer. Allen puts his gun on the desk. Lieutenant Mauch pulls out a black wooden gun.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: Here we go. This is a dummy gun. They use it for ceremony. It’s wooden. Knocks it on the table.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (holds up Allen's gun) You get this back when you can prove to me you can handle it.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: This isn’t working Lieutenant. Dobbs needs a new partner. His got laid off.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I think we’re doing great. We’re still in the growing pains stage but I see a big upside.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: Not on my watch!

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Why did you say that?

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: Honestly, I was tired of dealing with you guys and it seemed strong and definitive. Now get out. Allen puts the gun in the holster. It doesn’t really fit and sticks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Midtown - lunch time crowd, eating outside over the exhaust of taxis. A construction crew is destroying a building with a WRECKING BALL, front end loaders, jackhammers and lots of dust.

dialogues.speaker: FOREMAN
dialogues.text: Let’s go! Lunch! As the CONSTRUCTION WORKERS leave their posts, a SOLDIER type, 30s, buzz cut, in a track suit, jumps up on the wrecking ball.

dialogues.speaker: FOREMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey! Get outta there! What the hell are you doing? The Soldier pulls out a TASER GUN and shoots off two electric prongs into the Foreman who convulses and hits the ground.

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC
dialogues.text: We see the soldier is swinging the heavy lead ball across 5th Avenue. It crushes one cab, and sends another flying across the Avenue. People run for cover as the giant ball swings back and forth, narrowing in on it’s target-- The CARTIER FLAGSHIP STORE on Fifth Avenue. The Ex-Soldier speaks into a headset, timing with the swinging ball.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: In three... two... one. The window and whole front of the CARTIER store SHATTERS. TWO MORE SOLDIER-TYPES run and start cleaning out the Cartier window of diamonds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allen and Terry are working at their desks.

dialogues.speaker: FOSSE
dialogues.text: Hey Allen, all this month, flash your badge at any pizzeria, free pizza.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I know it’s not true! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: That’s enough, I’m serious over here!

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: What’d you care? You hate him.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I never used the word hate. And he’s still my partner. You guys are just J holes with ties.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: But is it true? About the pizza? Cause it would be nice. You always see it on tv shows... free food for cops.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO DISPATCH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Robbery in process. 470 Fifth Avenue. They’re using a wrecking ball to clean out Cartiers. Everyone scrambles.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN/FOSSE
dialogues.text: We got it!

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Already heading out. We HEAR Danson’s voice come over the radio.

dialogues.speaker: MANZETTI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (over the radio) Yeah, Danson and Manzetti. We’re rolling heavy.

dialogues.speaker: DANSON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey Felicia, I'll pick you up a nice anklet while I’m there.

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) You’re the best Danson. Terry, Allen, Fosse and Martin turn back to their desks. Terry loses it. He kicks over a water cooler.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Dammit! I’m a peacock! Let me fly!

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Terry don’t... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: God gave me wings!! Let me use em!!

dialogues.speaker: FOSSE
dialogues.text: Wow. That is uncomfortable to watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danson and Manzetti fish tail their car in front of Cartier. The Ex-Soldiers have loaded up the their CARGO VAN and are speeding off.

dialogues.speaker: MANZETTI
dialogues.text: Well, well, well... At least they've got good taste.

dialogues.speaker: DANSON
dialogues.text: I’m a Movado man myself. Danson and Manzetti punch the accelerator and give chase. The Ex-Soldiers cut through traffic and SLO MO crash into a water fountain in front of an Office Building. The Van flips and rolls by the front entrance and the Soldiers climb out and run for the building.

dialogues.speaker: MANZETTI
dialogues.text: I don’t know who’s crazier. Us or them! Danson and Manzetti screech to a stop and chase after them into the high rise building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danson and Manzetti haul ass into the lobby and into an elevator. They hit the “40th floor” and “close door”. As the doors close, an old hand reaches in. An OLD LADY talking to her DAUGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: OLD LADY
dialogues.text: Fifteen. Danson hits fifteen. Both guys sigh. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: OLD LADY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I told him let me get you a TV tray. He said I’1l just put the plate on my lap. I said, this tray has a snow scene of Vermont on it. You can eat, enjoy the snow scene and watch “Wheel of Fortune” at the same time. He told me to shut up about the damn TV tray. He just came to hook up the cable and he wanted to leave. Fifteenth Floor opens up. The Old Lady looks out of the doors.

dialogues.speaker: OLD LADY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nope. This isn’t it. It’s either the 16th or 22nd or the 28th. She starts hitting a bunch of floors.

dialogues.speaker: DANSON
dialogues.text: Dammit. Stairs. Danson pushes the doors open and they run out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stair doors crash open. Danson comes out, breathing hard, followed by Manzetti.

dialogues.speaker: MANZETTI
dialogues.text: You been eating too much of Sal’s pizza. They both split up and scan the roof. Danson looks over edge to the street below as Manzetti runs over.

dialogues.speaker: DANSON
dialogues.text: Dammit. Their POV: Two Ex-Soldiers are on the ground waiting for the third. THE THIRD IS MIDWAY DOWN AN IMPRESSIVE ZIP LINE SLIDE THAT’S BEEN SHOT OUT OF THE 20TH FLOOR TO THE STREET BELOW.

dialogues.speaker: DANSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: These guys are pros. They both lock eyes. They know each other only too well.

dialogues.speaker: MANZETTI
dialogues.text: Are you thinking what I’m thinking? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They both stand on the ledge. In SLO MO we see them LEAP OFF THE 40 STORY BUILDING, arms waving, feet bicycling. It’s glorious!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON the blur of drumsticks held by white gloves. RAT-A-TAT-TAT followed by the HUMM of bagpipes. MUSIC: “Amazing Grace” As played by the NYPD Pipe and Drum Corp during a funeral procession. We see COPS lined up in dress blues, white gloves - it’s an impressive turnout for impressive guys. News Crews cover the story as two horse drawn coffins slowly make their way past the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayor gives a eulogy.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: Two days ago, this city wept. We lost two heroes who gave everything for this city... As we PAN ACROSS the crowd we HEAR quips from different cops.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Who jumps from forty stories? ...past another cop.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: I heard Manzetti has an eighty eight I.Q. -- that’s clinically diagnosed as “dull”. .».. past another cop.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: .+. I had a piece of art in my front yard. Real nice modern sculpture... Manzetti took a shit in. Thought it was a toilet. Not a smart guy. The Mayor continues. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: I only hope in Heaven, God will give them a medal, a slice of Sal’s and a silver plated .44 just to keep everyone in check. Lots of laughs. We end on Terry and Allen. Everyone salutes the coffins as the DRUM starts up. Terry and Allen whisper to each other.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: This is our moment Allen. Our moment to be the guys, step up, fill the void.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: This is a funeral! Have some respect!

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What? You don’t think every other team here isn’t thinking the same? They both look across to see Martin and Fosse - also whispering, conspiring. Both parties catch each other looking and guiltily stop chatting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC: TASTEFUL STRING VERSION OF Bruce Springsteen’s “Glory Days.” It’s the Memorial Service following the funeral. A lot of people are eating baked ziti off of paper plates.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: (on cell phone) I‘1l be home when I’m home! Just put the dinner on the stove! Bye! He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My wife is a real piece of work. Martin and Fosse walk up to Allen and Terry.

dialogues.speaker: FOSSE
dialogues.text: Hey, you guys seemed real talkative at the funeral. Real talkative. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Scheming like two little mouthy bitches.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Hey, if you guys are looking to mix it up. I’m all about that.

dialogues.speaker: FOSSE
dialogues.text: (laughing) You’re not worth the pit stains. Look at these two jamokes. One shot Jeter, the other shot an office.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Guys, keep it down. We’re ata funeral. Fosse steps up into Allen’s face.

dialogues.speaker: FOSSE
dialogues.text: (whispering) Watch it Gamble. I‘’1l smash your little bean counting nose so far down your throat you'll be able to smell your own taint! Terry steps up to Fosse’s face.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: (also whispering) Come on Fosse... You wanna roll? I’‘1l kick your fat head in and then use your brain juice as shoe shine. Bob interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Hey guys. You have that ziti? It’s really outstanding.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Get outta here Bob. Martin lunges at Terry. THEY START VICIOUSLY BRAWLING ON THE GROUND BUT QUIETLY, trying not to draw attention.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: (gently whispering) Take him, Terry. Take him! It’s the quietest nasty fight ever. Some other cops come over and start cheering on Martin but all in whispers. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FOSSE AND OTHER COPS
dialogues.text: (all in a whisper) Kick his ass Martin....Come on...That’s it....Fuck him up! Danson’s WIDOW, 19, walks by. Allen nods to her with the whisper fight behind him.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I’m very sorry for your loss. The Lieutenant runs over and whisper yells at them.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: (whisper yelling) What the hell is going on?! I’m over there consoling the grieving family and you guys are having a damn street brawl? He looks at Fosse and a bloody-nosed Martin, then at Terry and Allen.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (whisper yell) We’re at a goddamn funeral! Two men have died!

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: (whisper) I told them that. A weeping WOMAN walks by being consoled by the D.A.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: Sorry for your loss...Hello Frank...Sorry for your loss. As soon as they pass, Terry punches Martin and they go at it again.

dialogues.speaker: ALL
dialogues.text: (whisper cheering) Kick his ass...Oh!...Come On! The Lieutenant pulls them apart again.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: That’s enough you jackals! The Lieutenant undoes his tie and pulls out a RED VEST. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you need anything I’m doing the night shift at Target. Tonight's Manager special - Oster Blenders. Great for the wives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Terry walking out taking off his tie. Allen catches up to him.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Thanks for stepping in back there. I think I could’ve handled it, though.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: He had the drop on you. He was on your weak side, backlit, not your dominant eye - you wouldn't of seen the first punch.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Well thanks. Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I’ve got to go see my ol’ lady. Someone who gets me. He keeps walking. Allen keeps up.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I didn’t know you had a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC: TCHAIKOVSKY - Plucky Harp Several dancers stretch on the rail. One woman stands out -- she’s beautiful and graceful. This is FRANCINE. A svelte, muscular, BLACK MALE DANCER holds her leg. Terry and Allen enter -- clearly out of place.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: FRANCINE
dialogues.text: I’m dancing. What are you doing here? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I love you Francine. You don’t even ask about Terry Junior. He misses you.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCINE
dialogues.text: Terry Junior is a dog! You named him after yourself to try and guilt me.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Everyone on the block still asks about you. Slappy and ChooChoo and the guys still sing doo-wop tunes around the ash can. They can’t believe we’re not together.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCINE
dialogues.text: You have to stop! You have to give up on this fantasy. I moved on a long, long time ago. The black dancer walks over.

dialogues.speaker: DANCER
dialogues.text: Francine, is this guy bothering you?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Who’s this guy? He your new boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: FRANCINE
dialogues.text: He’s my dance partner Terry.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What? You don’t think I can do this shit? Terry turns around and does an impressive pirouet into a arabesque into a grande jete en attitude. He walks away.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I love you Francine!

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: He loves you Francine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allen walks with Terry. Terry's upset.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I didn’t know you could dance. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: We used to do those dance moves to make fun of guys. Show em how queer they were.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: You learned to dance like that sarcastically?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I guess.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I just realized after a year working together, you've never been to my house for dinner or met Sheila.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Your wife seems like a real ball buster.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Sheila? Yeah I married young. But she’s harmless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a Prius parked in front on a modest brownstone in a middle class Queens neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry and Allen are seated at a modest dining nook table. The house feels like a Math Teacher's, humble yet smart. Allen is showing Terry some paper work.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Here are three downtown construction sites that are totally unpermitted. And this is just from last month. The budget cuts have gutted any regulatory teeth the city had.....

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Don’t you get it? Danson and Manzetti are gone. When I said this was our chance to step up, I didn’t mean this. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Honestly, does anyone know why they jumped off that building?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Who cares? There’s a vacuum in this city and we could fill it! Allen, it’s time to be a real cop!

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Soup’s on! Just then Allen’s wife SHEILA, 34, comes in with dinner. SHE IS ABSOLUTELY STUNNING. She wears a sun dress and could easily be a movie star or model.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: You must be Terry. Sorry I’ve been hiding, this was a tricky dinner.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Uh, hi. You're Allen’s wife?

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: I know people are always shocked because he’s Episcopalian and I’m Catholic. But it works.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: This smells delicious honey. Are you going to change for dinner?

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: I already did.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Uh-oh! Foot goes in mouth! Seriously though honey, are you going to change? You look, not so great and we have company.... Sheila is seated and serving dinner.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: I’m sorry baby. Just for tonight I thought I’d go casual.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: It’s no big deal.... You look nice.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: You don’t have to be polite Terry. She looks terrible. (holds up iPhone) (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is my People Magazine Fashion App. I typed in what you’re wearing and you got aC plus.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Allen loves his Apps. And screw People Magazine. I don’t want to look like Reese Witherspoon.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Why are you with Allen? I mean, how did you guys meet?

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Its a pretty typical “how we met” story Terry. I was a dancer for the Knicks while finishing my residency at Columbia Hospital. Allen came in, he hurt himself. He was unemployed and uninsured. Needless to say, I fell for him immediately.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Not immediately.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: That’s right... Allen was still dating his old girlfriend Dianne Lane. But once they split I jumped in there.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: You dated Dianne Lane?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: (mouth full) Y-up. Dark days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry says goodbye to Allen and Sheila.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: It was really nice meeting you Terry!

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Likewise, Sheila. Allen, remember what I said. This is our time. Starting tomorrow we both clock in ready to rock and roll. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: So what’s that? Bicycle pants, mesh top and Reeboks?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: No. Start with not that and work from there. Thanks again for dinner. They close the door but we hear Sheila as it closes.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Why would you dress up as a French Maid? The house is clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An alarm clock goes off at 6:00 AM. Next to it is a badge and a gun. We hear news radio blaring.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS ANCHOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: 1010 WINS! Stock Market drops 220 but the big story, a shooting on the Westside Highway leaves a Bronx women hospitalized- We see Terry asleep in his bed. His bedroom is a mess of dirty clothes. He reaches over and hits the alarm off.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I got this one. MUSIC: AC/DC “Ride On”

dialogues.speaker: TERRY GETTING DRESSED
dialogues.text: -Jeans pulled up. -T-shirt thrown on. -Knife taped to his calf. -Cool necklace. -A dab of WARNING SHOT Cologne -Shoulder holster strapped and gleaming Baretta locked and loaded. -Topped off with a well worn leather jacket.  35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors fling open on a dusty old garage REVEALING a car under a cover. Terry flings off the cover - IT'S AN AMAZING 1970 DODGE CORONET - a classic cop car. Shiny black, cherry. He gives the car a little kiss.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: It’s our time Carol. At the end of the driveway, Allen pulls up in his Prius. He sees Terry leaning against his impressive Dodge.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Let’s just take mine! MUSIC OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allen drives with Terry in the passenger seat. Both their heads are crammed into the car cause of its low ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I apologize in advance if I’ma little out of it. Sheila and I got into last night.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What were you guys fighting about?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: She wants to take this blow job class at the Learning Annex and we just don’t have the money in the budget. Women, huh?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Yeah... that’s... messed up. Allen takes out his iPhone and makes a call.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yeah, I’m tailing driver number 649. I just have to say, he’s doing quite well.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What are you doing? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Allen motions to the bumper sticker on the back of the truck in front of them which reads. “How Am I Driving 1- 800-DRV CMMT.”

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Calling in with a report.... (back to phone) He’s patient. He’s signalling at the all the proper times and he’s keeping a nice even speed. He’s a real pleasure. Okay, have a nice day. He clicks off his phone.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: You gotta be kidding me.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: How so?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Why you’d do that?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: This country thrives on feedback. That guy will drive back to work and there'll be a nice message waiting for him. It’s called Pay it Forward. The radio crackles in the car.

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We've got shots fired. 232 Grand street. There are large amounts of narcotics on the scene. Terry picks up the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Detective Hoitz and Gamble. We got it! We hear Martin and Fosse crackle on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN, (VO)
dialogues.text: This is Detectives Martin and Fosse. Fuck you Hoitz. This one’s ours!

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Punch it! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: America!! Terry pops in a CD on the radio. Bad ass heavy metal kicks in. MUSIC: PRONG’S “SNAP YOUR FINGERS, SNAP YOUR NECK” Allen cuts through traffic with his Prius. He puts a little Radio Shack siren on the roof. It has a cigarette lighter charger that runs across his face from the roof. MUSIC: CHANGES TO LITTLE RIVER BAND “REMINISCING”

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: LRB. Little River Band.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: The idea is we play some music to get us pumped for the call.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Exactly. Allen turns up LRB louder. Terry turns it off.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Let’s go with no music.

dialogues.speaker: FOSSE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is Detectives Martin and Fosse en route. We are two minutes out!

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: (into radio) Negative! Hoitz and Gamble have already made the call!!

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hoitz and Gamble should get ready to do our paperwork. And please don’t shoot any beloved baseball players.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Punch it Allen! I swear to God you drop that foot like a lead weight or I’m going to shoot you in the foot!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Abhhh!!!! I’m gonna do it!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allen punches the accelerator and THE CAR SHOOTS OFF LIKE A ROCKET. Swerving in and out of traffic, going at least ninety.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: That’s too fast!! Easy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE SHOT as Allen DRIVES RIGHT THROUGH THE YELLOW TAPE AND INTO THE CRIME SCENE. A bag of white powder explodes in the air as their car hits it.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: AHHHHHHHHHHHHIIIILL Lh hilt We hear the telltale BUMP of driving over a body as they stop. The entire crowds GASPS and stares in shock. The crime scene is destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry and Allen sit in the Prius as Martin and Fosse coolly walk up.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: That was nice guys. Forensics is gonna love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin and Fosse run the show while Terry and Allen stand with the crowd behind yellow tape. Fosse emerges from a building with a GUY in handcuffs. The CROWD CHEERS. Martin and Fosse turn to the GATHERED PRESS -- light flashes, reporters, etc.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Let’s just say, the only white powder these guys will be dealing is flour in the kitchen for a bunch of inmates. There’s a beat of silence -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FOSSE
dialogues.text: Making biscuits! Then the Reporters cheer. Several do their sign offs.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Looks like it’s prison biscuits for these criminals. But the real question is: Are Martin and Fosse the new Super Cops!? Only time will tell.... Allen pops in behind the Reporter #2’s shot.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Except they’re not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An upscale restaurant. Terry and Allen sit at a table in as A WAITER prepares a Caesar salad for them table side. WE SEE THE WAITER IS ACTUALLY LIEUTENANT MAUCH.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: I can’t have you guys out there wrecking crime scenes.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Sorry Lieutenant. Martin and Fosse jumped our call.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: Crime is changing detectives. A BUSBOY comes over and fills the water glasses.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You guys remember, Guillermo Vasquez? Busted seventeen times for B&E.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Hey. I think I broke your collarbone once. What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: BUSBOY
dialogues.text: Right before I took this job, I broke into an apartment. Was going to grab a plasma screen, a couple of lap tops. You know what they had? An afghan and four CDs. People are hurting bro. Sparkling or flat? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Flat. Lieutenant is serving the salad, it’s elaborate.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: All I’m saying is be sure you make your cases count. Drugs, animals and sex. Those are the crimes that get air time and keep our budget up. Fresh pepper?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN/TERRY
dialogues.text: Yes....Please.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: And if you guys feel like bitching, remember I should have retired three years ago. Now I’m working three jobs.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Not to be a pain but can I get this without anchovies?

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: Go jump up your own ass. The Lieutenant goes to serve another table.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How’s the birthday boy doing!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry and Allen sit in the car eating sandwiches.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: How long you been with Francine?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: We dated five years.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: That’s tough. Were you guys high school sweethearts?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: No. Fourth grade to eighth grade. It was intense. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: So you were twelve when you split?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Yeah. I just can’t get her out of my heart. I remember this one time in fifth grade we were throwing bricks at an old TV in the garbage and she took my Sprees and I was crying. Listen to me, I sound like a Movie of the Week.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I guess...Man, that’s young.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Braveheart met his wife when she was six. A call comes over the dispatch.

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Get out your cash rewards cards, here’s a good one -- some reality star is holding a lingerie model hostage at the Plaza. We HEAR sirens start up in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: This is Detectives Hoitz and Gamble en route! (to Allen) This time I drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin and Fosse are mentoring a bunch of SIXTH GRADERS.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: You're going to be getting a lot of pressure to join a gang. And there’s one way to avoid this. And that is- A CALL comes over Fosse’s radio.

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (crackly barely audible) Hostage situation...lingerie model... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FOSSE
dialogues.text: We got to go!

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Yep. Okay where are the guns? Pass’em to the front! Martin and Fosse look out to the kids who are passing around their guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry and Allen drive. They look up. News Helicopters litter the sky.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Everyone’s coming out for this one. Allen hits the music: MUSIC: Little River Band’s “Night Owl”

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: No! No more. Clearly we have differences in music. You listen to what you want, I’1l listen to what I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry and Allen barrel down the street, IN SILENCE WITH IPOD HEAD PHONES ON, clearly grooving to their own beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: News vans screech to a halt in front of the Plaza Hotel where a dozen cop cars and police are surrounding the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry and Allen driving. Something catches Allen’s eye.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Stop the car! The car screeches to a stop in front of an upscale apartment building. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: This better be Jimmy Hoffa selling crack to OJ! Allen is standing and looking at a residential building with scaffolding while checking his iPhone.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: This is a death trap.... An absolute death trap. Terry gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: If you say the word “permit” I’m gonna clock you I really am. Cop cars with sirens blaring screech past in the background.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I’m checking records on my City permits app and there’s nothing on this address! Six tons of scaffolding over a public sidewalk and they don’t fill out a permit? Building’s registered to a David Ershon -- money manager. Allen has his picture on his phone. Just then DAVID ERSHON, the man from the 60 Minutes interview, exits the building in a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir? Are you David Ershon? The Gentleman starts moving towards the limo. Allen stands in front of him. ALLEN (CONT’D) Are you David Ershon?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID ERSHON
dialogues.text: Yes, now if you could please move, I’m in a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: You have the right to remain silent. Anything you do or say can be, can be... What’s the next part?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Can be used as a flotation device. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Can be used as a flotation device. Okay, that’s not funny. It’s been awhile since I’ve Miranda’d someone, okay?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID ERSHON
dialogues.text: It certainly took you long enough. I guess I always pictured a more impressive arrest scene. Allen leads Ershon to the car. We hear their radio blare.

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hostage taker has been disarmed by Detectives Martin and Fosse. I repeat Martin and Fosse have the collar.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Un-cocksuckin-believable! We blew it! Allen pushes Ershon into the back seat and gets in.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: You have the right to an attorney, anything you say can be... used to do stuff... Terry gets into the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Martin and Fosse won’t pay for a drink for months and we’re chasing permit violations!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID ERSHON
dialogues.text: Wait, what am I being arrested for? SUDDENLY - CRASH! The Prius is rammed into from the side, knocking it onto the sidewalk. Terry and Allen are dazed. We see a BIG WHITE ESCALADE has just him them.

dialogues.speaker: SFX
dialogues.text: Allen gets out with license and registration. It’s in SLO MO as the effects of the accident fade.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: License and registration right here! Let’s do this by the books. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Escalade was driven by a TALL ARMENIAN and SHORT ARMENIAN (think Vic Darchinyan). Both wear suits and have mean looking faces but with big pleasant looking smiles. We ramp down out of the SLO MO as the two imposing men walk towards Allen.

dialogues.speaker: SHORT ARMENIAN
dialogues.text: (soothing) Please.... Please...please...

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Everyone okay?

dialogues.speaker: TALL ARMENIAN
dialogues.text: Please... please. The hypnotic “pleases” allow the Armenians to walk right up to Terry and Allen. They REVEAL TWO LARGE PISTOLS under their jackets and get the drop on the guys.

dialogues.speaker: SHORT ARMENIAN
dialogues.text: Please. They take away Terry’s gun, The Short Armenian takes Allen’s gun and sniffs it and then laughs.

dialogues.speaker: SHORT ARMENIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in Armenian) He has a wooden gun!

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: (clipped) Do not let these men take me! It will be a very bad everyone! CRASH! A BLACK RANGE ROVER slams into the back of the Escalade sending it flying. Out jump a SOUTH AMERICAN MAN AND WOMAN, (Think Ricardo Mayorga and Vivian Castro). Their GUNS are IMMEDIATELY REVEALED UNDER THEIR SHIRTS. The Armenians steps back.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Are we in the middle of a drug deal? What is this?

dialogues.speaker: SOUTH AMERICAN MAN
dialogues.text: I am very sorry. Everyone has guns drawn, except Terry and Allen. The hot South American jostles them around.

dialogues.speaker: SOUTH AMERICAN MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I am very sorry. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: They’re all very polite.

dialogues.speaker: THE HOT SOUTH AMERICAN WOMAN STARES AT ALLEN FOR A BEAT,
dialogues.text: DRINKING HIM IN. Then she gets in his car and drives away with Ershon in it. The Range Rover quickly follows. SCREECH! They look over and one of the Armenians drives off in the Escalade. It all went down in a matter of seconds leaving Allen and Terry with no car, no guns and somehow no shoes.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What just happened? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: When did they take my shoes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a long lens shot of Allen and Terry walking towards us down lst Avenue. They look tired and beaten. People give the barefoot duo looks as they walk.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I don’t get why we can’t call the office and have a blue and white pick us up?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: No. No way that call’s going out on the radio. No way.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Then at least let’s take the subway.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: See, unlike you I have friends. And occasionally I bump into them on subways.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I’m calling. Feels for his phone, nothing.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dammit! My phone was in the car! You know how many apps I had on that? Sixty. Sixty apps. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk 47.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (off Terry) You don’t care, do you?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: No. Not at all. for a beat longer passing some restaurants.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Hey, it’s your birthday in a few days.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: How do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I make the birthday calender for the office.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I thought that got torn down five minutes after it was put up?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Yes, it did. And they drenched it in toilet water and put it in my desk with a note that said “We’re cops not second graders.”

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: That’s pretty nasty. But honestly you do anything on my birthday and I’1l punch your head. Understood?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with celebrating a birthday?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I’m in my late thirties. There's no more growth to mark. No more milestones. I just down a shot and say “Hey I didn’t get stabbed or hit by a car this year. Down the hatch!”

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: That is bleak.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: You know what’s bleak? A party store. Go into one of those, fluorescent lights, cheap crap. People trying to buy a good time. The best parties just happen. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat Beat. 48. (2)

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ve got some wine! Hey, I just met these Puerto Rican girls! Party!

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Why were you in a party store in the first place?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Okay, you got me. It was Francine’s 12th birthday and I went to town. Balloons, streamers, magnetic mustache games for favors. That’s the day she broke up with me.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: But you were twelve?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Can you believe it? I ate pop rocks and Pepsi to try and do myself in. But it just made my mouth tingle.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What was with you and the hot Latin chick back there. You guys had a moment.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t say that.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me? She undressed you, did you and left a twenty on the bed on her way out all in her mind.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: You're nuts.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What'd you care, your wife’s crazy hot.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Who Sheila? Come on. She’s cute. I love her. But she’s not hot. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: You're delusional dude. She’s insanely hot.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Well that’s nice of you to say and I‘1l pass on the compliment.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Don’t tell your wife I said she’s hot. She’1l think I’m a creep. Beat

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Once again, what the hell just happened?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I think we were just in the middle of a kidnapping. We watch the two cops walk down the street barefoot. INT. D.A.’S SPECIAL UNIT OFFICES - TWO HOURS LATER Martin and Fosse are both trying on sunglasses. There's a large tray and a HOT SALESGIRL. Fosse’s got a pair of rose colored Foster Grants.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: I like ‘em. They really frame your face. Make you look thinner. Terry and Allen enter -- they’ve been walking the streets barefoot for two hours. Terry enters and makes a grand announcement.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Okay folks, we’ve got a high profile kidnapping. Might be drugged related, might be terrorist.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: (equally enthused) That’s right folks, we said the “T” word! Martin and Fosse look over interested. Both wearing sunglasses. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I’m going to need someone from the motor pool. We got a missing car.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Who got kidnapped? Terry paces, speaks and enjoys the stage.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: David Ershon, wealthy upper eastside resident. We’re looking at multi national team, possibly working in concert. Too early to tell.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Not making assumptions! The rest of the precinct starts to act.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: We need full cooperation of all departments, Terry and I will be running point.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Interface people! Interface!

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: Okay, slow down. Talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Okay, we apprehended David Ershon for questioning concerning a building violation. While in our custody-- is someone writing this down? While in our custody, we were blind sided and then overtaken by four members of a multinational kidnapping death squad. Really? No one’s writing this down? We were then stripped of our weapons and our shoes and Ershon was violently abducted. We should expect a ransom phone call within minutes. All it takes is a pen and paper!! It’s called a statement!

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: They took your guns?

dialogues.speaker: FOSSE AND OTHER COPS
dialogues.text: And your shoes? Why shoes? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Enough about the shoes! Now I suggest we start working the streets or this guy’s coming home in a body bag!

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Guys, heads up. Guys? They just said your guy’s name on the Knicks game? Everyone turns to the Knicks game on the TV.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Nate Robinson, for threeee! And Nate high fives David Ershon and his date.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER II, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The guy has game and I’m talking about Ershon.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: I guess they’re holding your guy hostage court side! Everyone in the squad room laughs and walks away. Terry walks over to the TV and looks at Ershon with his super model girlfriend, who we only see half of.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Who is this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allen and Terry are with an employee at the Apple Store, TIM LEE, 30s wearing the Apple iPhone shirt, cop demeanor surrounded by kids. They are standing at the Genius Bar.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Tim, we appreciate this.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: You kidding? It’s all I enjoy doing. Tim starts typing.

dialogues.speaker: TIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Any idea when the city might bring back the computer forensic lab? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Not looking good. Laid off twenty more detectives last month.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: Yeah, that’s what I thought. Apple Store EMO KID EMPLOYEE approaches Tim.

dialogues.speaker: EMPLOYEE
dialogues.text: Tim, you want to switch shifts tomorrow? I really wanna go see Radiohead.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: How about I shove an iShuffle up your ass and you learn something about responsibility? Huh? How about that?

dialogues.speaker: EMPLOYEE
dialogues.text: I was just asking, you don’t have to be a douche. The kid walks off.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: (keeping it moving) So any luck?

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: I think you’re really going to like this. Grab a seat. Terry and Allen grab a seat in the Apple Theater. MUSIC UP: SADE “Smooth Operator” On the giant screen images start to flash as a track that Tim recorded earlier, there’s amazing graphics, dissolves of photos, great animation.

dialogues.speaker: TIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I used a Morgan Freeman voice over app.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m getting that!

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN FREEMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: David Ershon, born Gale Forentsky in Gainsville, Florida to parents Eve and Tate Forentsky, ran a dry cleaning concern in downtown Gainsville. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a P 53. (2)

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: He’s not even English.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN FREEMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: After graduating from Florida State, Gale Forentsky changed his name to “David Ershon”. He became a fast rising star in the investment world and in 2005 started the Ershon Consortium, current financial holdings are said to exceed 70 Billion Euros. They are the only investment firm to show profits during the 2009 collapse. Lives a lavish lifestyle with wife Evika Hellimenez, arguably the most beautiful woman on the earth. Three times Ms. Universe. IXALATED PHOTO OF A WOMAN.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN FREEMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The 97 cm, 121 KGs beauty is so sexy that any photograph of her automatically receives an R rating.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Ah Tim, why is everything in metric?

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: Sounds cooler in kilos and Euros.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I’ve always thought that. The presentation continues.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN FREEMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The only financier to have a corporate skybox at the Senate. Ershon has one of the largest wine and cheese collections in the world. He frequently hangs out with Judge Anthony Scalia, Brody Jenner, and the lead singer of Maroon 5. The BIG SCREEN is interrupted by “GEARS OF WAR”.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: Garry, get off the main drive! I’m working! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ..-Back to the presentation.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN FREEMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Mr. Ershon was made an honorary member of the Baldwin Family in 2004. And the future looks nothing but bright for this rising star of the finance world. The lights come on. Music stops.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: Sorry guys. This guy’s legit.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Keep digging.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Love the presentation. Really impressive.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: Let me know if you hear of any jobs opening up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry and Allen drive down the street in Terry’s bad ass big American car. It is pluming black smoke behind it.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I don’t buy he’s squeaky clean. Once I see guns and airline tickets I know someone left a trout in the tanning bed.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: This guy’s got a lot of foreign investments. The car rumbles and backfires.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do you get, six miles to the gallon?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Five but there’s more to a car than that. He revs and the 8 cylinders light up like a stallion. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry pull 55.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: That means nothing. Definitions of power are changing every day. Who would win in a fight, Noble Prize winning economist Paul Krugman or ultimate fighter Ken Shamrock?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Ken Shamrock.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Really? But then Paul Krugman manipulates currency rates devaluing Ken Shamrocks earning power, leading to unemployment and less time working out.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: And Ken Shamrock walks in and punches Krugman in the face.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Don’t get me wrong, I love Ken Shamrock. I’m a huge fan. But in the long run Krugman comes out ahead.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: But in the short run Shamrock arm bars Krugman.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I could not be a bigger Ken Shamrock fan. But Shamrock has gimpy knees and is broke by the time he’s forty having in no way affected the world. Meanwhile Krugman? Just started collecting awards.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: You asked who would win and I told you. (looks at dash) Ah, look at that. I gotta fill up. s into a gas station. EXT. ERSHON’S HOUSE - NIGHT Ershon and his Girlfriend, who’s face is pixilated, enter the house. The two Brazilians stand outside. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SOUTH AMERICAN MAN
dialogues.text: Good night. We will be here. The door shuts. They look up to see the Armenians’ Escalade drive by slowly. The Brazilians hold their guns under their jackets and stare them down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jenklow Art Gallery.

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC
dialogues.text: Francine is surrounded by patrons and artists. She looks stunning in a designer dress and holds a glass of wine. TERRY WALKS IN, grabs a glass of wine and approaches her. He starts to put the wine on the table. A WORKER...

dialogues.speaker: WORKER
dialogues.text: Whoa. Whoa. Whoa. That’s an installation.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What? This coffee table? It’s a coffee table -- magazines, an ashtray, remote control, half empty coffee mug, wrappers. Terry looks closely at the price listing.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Five hundred thousand?

dialogues.speaker: WORKER
dialogues.text: Yeah. Francine approaches.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCINE
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I wanna be with you.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCINE
dialogues.text: Terry, we dated thirty years ago. We weren’t allowed to have matches when we were together.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: You’re lost baby. This world’s got you all upside down. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francine’s 57.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You should be in my arms and instead you’re selling dirty coffee tables. Look at this, it’s nonsense.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCINE
dialogues.text: It’s a comment on the inanity of our consumer culture. The chaos of the coffee table represents our fractured ego.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: It’s not art, it’s a dirty coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCINE
dialogues.text: The fact that we’re discussing this, makes it art. You think you can do this? You can’t. BOSS, 52, comes over. He’s wearing square glasses, a Paul Smith suit jacket and T-shirt that says “I'M GAY.”

dialogues.speaker: BOSS
dialogues.text: Is this man bothering you Francine?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Francine, you actually have sex with this creep?

dialogues.speaker: FRANCINE
dialogues.text: He’s gay Terry. He’s wearing a shirt that says “I’m gay.” And he’s also my boss.

dialogues.speaker: BOSS
dialogues.text: It’s an ironic vintage shirt. Except the irony is ironic because I am gay.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCINE
dialogues.text: Everything’s fine Mr. Reeger. He’s leaving.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What about us?

dialogues.speaker: FRANCINE
dialogues.text: There is no us.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Fine. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Terry reaches down and moves a spoon a fraction of an inch on the coffee table. People scream!

dialogues.speaker: FRANCINE/PATRONS
dialogues.text: Ahh!... Oh Dear God no!!... Sweet Jesus!!! Terry busts out of the gallery.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: My love for you is art!!! The whole Gallery groans.

dialogues.speaker: PATRONS
dialogues.text: Ohhhh....Oh brother!...Painful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see three OFFICERS in Hazmat suits scrubbing Allen's Prius. It’s a mess. A tire is gone, as is the back passenger side door. Terry and Allen enter.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Are you guys dusting for prints? Everyone laughs. The head of the Motor Pool, OFFICER WATTS, 48 walks them to the car.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER WATTS
dialogues.text: Hardly. From fluid and hair samples we’ve determined a bunch of homeless old men had an orgy in the car.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Oh God.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER WATTS
dialogues.text: Then shortly after, a Dominican woman gave birth on the floor. And then to top it off some guy took a nifty little dump in the driver’s seat. It was a little swirl. Almost cute. He must have found out you were a cop. It was a spite shit.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: You can tell all that from fluid and hair samples? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: One of the Officers in the Hazmat suit holds up a plastic bag with Allen’s iPhone in it.
