dialogues.speaker: HAZMAT OFFICER
dialogues.text: Is this yours?!

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Oh my God, Carol!

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER WATTS
dialogues.text: The guy named a piece of machinery Carol. That’s F’d up, huh?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Yeah... So you guys see any sign of a struggle or find any shells?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER WATTS
dialogues.text: Believe me, everyone who participated in the orgy was more than willing. So, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry and Allen are sitting on the couch of the Lieutenant's office.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: Mayor’s office wants you to back off.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Back off of what?

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: Ershon. He called and apologized, played his political card, huge contributor to every pol in town. He said his security guys got out of line. We’re fining them and then moving on. Lieutenant Mauch hands them each their guns. Allen still has a wooden gun.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They returned these. Allen they actually put a nice linseed oil and stain on yours. Terry stands up, heated. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: This is wrong Lieutenant! That was NOT a security team!

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: Leave it alone! There is no collar!

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: (to Terry) Look, I think what Lieutenant Mauch is saying, is pursue the case, but be careful.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: No, that’s not at all what I’m saying. I’m saying leave it alone!

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: (to Terry) Okay, so pursue the case but check in with him from time to time.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: Goddamit! I’m saying there is no case! It’s over! Lieutenant Mauch pulls out a folder.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here. Martin and Fosse have been begging for it. An unlicensed photo studio working on the lower east side. We’re talking drug use, animal trafficking. Real nasty stuff. It’s yours. He hand them the folder. It’s a bunch of cat photos for calendars, greeting cards, etc.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Kittens?

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: This has good PR all over it. Local news will eat this up. Don’t blow it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry and Allen walk down the hallway. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I want Ershon now.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: You heard the Lieutenant, we can only work the case on weekends.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: It’s too neat the way this got cleaned up. The Lieutenant should've had our backs when our guns were taken. Allen looks through his phone.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Hey there was a thirteen minute phone call after we were jumped.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: They used your phone?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: My phone ghost dialed.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: So it coulda picked up some of that conversation when Ershon got grabbed. We got to hear the other side of that call.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: (changes his mind) No, it’s probably nothing.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Nothing? It’s the only lead we have.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: It’s an ex-girlfriend. There’s no way I’m talking to her.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Do you realize this guy could be putting up illegal scaffolding right now?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I know, it’s tearing me up inside.  62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allen’s Prius is in front of a big house up in Westchester. They knock on the door. A really beautiful woman holding a cocktail answers the door. This is CHRISTINITH.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINITH
dialogues.text: Allen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christinith, Allen and Terry all sit in uncomfortable silence. Christinith’s cell phone sits on the coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINITH
dialogues.text: I waited for you in Tower Records for FOUR HOURS!

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. That was thirteen years ago.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINITH
dialogues.text: It feels like ten seconds to me. Her husband HAL walks in with a tray of drinks.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Just a little pause for the cause - - some Arnold Palmers. Sweetie, that one’s got the vodkey.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINITH
dialogues.text: Hal, just place them down.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Alrighty.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINITH
dialogues.text: I did things with you in bed that I've never done with anyone!

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Christinith your husband...?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINITH
dialogues.text: He knows all about us.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Christine, this is a lovely house. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINITH
dialogues.text: It’s Christinith! Are you deaf?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Look we really need the message. We believe there was a kidnapping.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINITH
dialogues.text: Do you remember how every morning I'd call and say, “I'd die for you"?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Yeah, it was........ sweet.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINITH
dialogues.text: It's still true.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: So can we hear the message?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINITH
dialogues.text: Come into the kitchen and I'll play it for you. Everyone else stay here.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Okay, sweetie. Allen and Christinith get up and leave Hal and Terry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allen follows Christinith into the kitchen. As soon as the door shuts, she turns and attacks Allen.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINITH
dialogues.text: Take me. Here. Now. Please! Take me! From upstairs we HEAR.

dialogues.speaker: KID, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Mom! Mom! Can you help with our art project?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINITH
dialogues.text: I‘1l be right there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry and the husband sit quietly. They can hear the activity in the kitchen. Crashing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: She was so excited when she saw he called.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christinith holds up an old snow cone wrapper.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINITH
dialogues.text: I saved it.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I don’t know what that is.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINITH
dialogues.text: Sno Cone wrapper you ate. August 1995 Great Adventure, right before you got on the Lighting Loops, this was in your mouth. You own my mouth. Allen breaks free. He runs out of the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Terry! Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allen lunges for her phone on the coffee table. Hal tries to stop him. Allen stiff arms him.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: You love her like she deserves to be loved! Give her heart back!

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: This is police evidence! Terry, let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allen and Terry run out of the house. Christinith screams from the porch.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINITH
dialogues.text: Allen!! Teach Hal how to be you!  65. INT. FINNEGAN’S BAR - NIGHT Traditional Irish Pub -- it’s packed. In the back room, guys hold their Guinness’, singing traditional Irish songs in a circle with heads down accapella.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE OF TOOME TODAY.
dialogues.text: We find Terry and Allen hovering over two beers, trying to listen to the messages on Christinith’s phone.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What did you do to that girl?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Nothing. I think I looked like her Dad. She’s very intense. (and then) Okay, here we go. On SPEAKER we hear:

dialogues.speaker: SFX
dialogues.text: We hear a conversation between Ershon and something that sounds Spanish.

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I panicked. More foreign language.

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell them I won’t do it again. Tell them it was just about some stupid building code violations.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What is that? Spanish? Allen looks at his phone.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: No. New iPhone app: language translator. See that? Portuguese. They continue listening to the Portuguese speaker. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Something about Banco Sao Paulo. Must be something with currencies, or currency reserves. They’re- A OLD MAN taps his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hold on. I’m up. Allen stands. He stares at the floor, tapping his hand on his thigh. Allen imme

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: AND ANNIE’S CHILD HELD HER SLEEVE

dialogues.speaker: WHEN THE SOLDIERS CAME A KNOCKING,
dialogues.text: SHE SAID THERE’S NOTHING LEFT TO

dialogues.speaker: TESS LAID THERE, NOT LETTING GO OF
dialogues.text: ‘ER SLEEVE. diately swings back to the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Currency reserves are usually a safe bet. But dealing with those countries in today’s times, who knows?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: So you think he’s dealing drugs?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: No! It’s not drugs! It’s not murder! It’s economies in flux, shadow banking, offshore accounts. We're going to have do paperwork, due diligence, financial ledgers.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Don’t you get it? That’s not who I am. (re his gun) This is cop work, what you’re talking about is homework.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Look, there’s more to being a cop than pulling a trigger. You gotta- The Old man taps Allen. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Already? (sings)

dialogues.speaker: WITH HER, IT WAS CONSENSUAL.
dialogues.text: Allen swings back to the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You gotta think internationally now and look for the deal that’s too good to be true! That’s police work!

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I came out of my mama’s privates ready to kick in doors and cuff perps! None of that is happening! I want to be a cop and I NEED TO

dialogues.speaker: BE A COP
dialogues.text: Terry starts to walk out. Allen starts to go after him but then jumps back into the song for one last line.

dialogues.speaker: GREW FLOWERS EVERMORE.
dialogues.text: Allen runs up to Terry and stops him. ALLEN (CONT’D) I’m sorry. I know this is all new for you.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I haven’t even cuffed someone in six months Allen. I’m starting to feel confused.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Liuetenant will kill us if we don’t look into this illegal photo studio...Let’s go be cops.

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A photo session is in progress. A CRAZY TWEAKER holds two kittens down on a table while, a SLEAZY EURO photographer snaps pictures. The room is dingy and filled with cages with kittens in them. Suddenly the DOOR is KICKED in. In FLY Terry and Allen.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Police! Step away from the kitten! The Euro pulls out a straight razor and the Tweaker takes out a buck knife. Terry is on them fast. He blocks the knife from the Tweaker and cuts the Italian with the blade nipping his ear. WE QUICKLY CUT TO THE CUTE KITTENS WATCHING. Terry steps back causing the two dirt bags to collide and snaps the Euro’s arm.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH CUT
dialogues.text: Six weeks later. The Italian is with a PHYSICAL THERAPIST he lifts a one pound weight with great strain.

dialogues.speaker: PHYSICAL THERAPIST
dialogues.text: That’s good Antonio... Very good. WE CUT BACK TO ACTION SCENE. Terry then grabs the TWEAKER by the neck and punches him super fast in the mouth three times. THE KITTENS WATCH. Terry then ducks down and smashes the Tweaker’s knee with a nearby light pole.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH CUT
dialogues.text: Six weeks later. The Tweaker is on the phone with his outstretched leg in a soft cast. He’s going over an insurance bill.

dialogues.speaker: TWEAKER
dialogues.text: No!... I already did the co-pay. But now they’re saying “Missed work” is not covered?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC: POGUES “Dirty Ol Town” Reporters everywhere. Terry and Allen exit the building to flashes. Allen holds two guns and a kitten, Terry holds a bag of meth and a kitten.  69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allen and Terry are in their dress blues as THE MAYOR pins medals on them. This is all FRAMED IN A FOX NEWS frame and corner bug.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: ..-For valor and bravery in the execution of duty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allen and Terry stand on the steps talking.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I feel dirty. We seized six hundred dollars in drugs and rescue ten cats and we’re the lead story on the news? Martin and Fosse walk by.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN/FOSSE
dialogues.text: Meooow..... meow....meoooowwww! !!

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Let’s go get this guy Ershon. MUSIC: AEROSMITH’s “Back in the Saddle Again”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allen is talking on his cell phone while Terry listens to his iPod.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: (on his phone) Good use of blinkers, nice even pace, considerate to pedestrians. All in all some fantastic driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry and Allen led by an ASSISTANT, 25, enter David Ershon’s amazing office with 270 degree views. David Ershon greets them with a hearty hand shake. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: (English accent) I had been trying to reach out to you. Please sit. (to Secretary) Three of those Russian waters, lime wedges, cucumber. As they sit down.

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: First off, I took care of those scaffolding issues. I thank you for pointing it out. I’m dealing with so many contractors, someone is always trying to cut corners. The Assistant hands Terry and Allen their waters. Allen sips

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Let's cut the crap Florida boy. We had you in our car and you were taken from us at gun point.

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: I do apologize. I deal with many high level international banks. My security force is always on high alert. What they saw was me being forced into a car unwillingly. I truly apologize. his water.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: God this is really good water!

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: You asked us not to let the first group of armed men take you. Why would you say that about your own security team?

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: Detective Hoitz, everyone involved has been reprimanded and will be attending a sensitivity seminar. To show my sincerity, I want to offer you my personal court side seats at the Knicks game and access to the Ambassador Club. Would you please accept them?  71.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ed Curry for twoooo0c00000! The Knicks score! We see Terry and Allen cheering from court side surrounded by celebrities. They both wear Knicks jerseys and hats.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: (shouts) I have to say, I feel funny about accepting these seats. Like we're being taking advantage of. Terry is mid-bite of a giant hot dog.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch! I saw “court side” and went blind. Let’s go back and play hard ball this time. They throw down their beers and walk off. INT. ERSHON’S OFFICE - NEXT DAY Terry and Allen enter, still in their Knicks swag.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: We're here to see Mr. Ershon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On stage MAMA MIA is hitting it’s big number, “Dancing Queen.” We PAN ACROSS the audience and find Allen and Terry waving their hands in the air and swaying to the music.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: (shouts) Dammit! You know he did it again!

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Sonuvabitch! You’re right! Let’s leave at the act break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry and Allen barge in. Ershon looks up from his desk. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: No more tickets!

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Mr. Ershon, I tried-

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: It’s okay. Could you get us three glacier waters with Mediterranean limes? How great is Mama Mia?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: It was good but I’ve listened to the catalogue of ABBA for years, but I’ve always had a different narrative in my head-

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: (interrupts) You're a liar Ershon. And we’re not going away. While Ershon talks, Allen sips another water with fruit.

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: My intention was never to “buy” you. But in my hand I have two tickets to the premiere, at the Zigfield Theater or Rob Shneider's “Chick Magnet. Where you will be sitting with in close proximity of Rob Schneider. Ershon holds up two large, impressive tickets.

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There's an after-party. Terry and Allen look at each other - a lot of “Maybe”"/"Maybe not” looks.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: (definitively) No... Right? (then) No! Definitely no. We need some answers.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: We want to know who those guys were! I want gun permits on everyone of them. Passports. I’m tired of this Leprechaun Breakfast you're giving us! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Two eggs and a thumb up your ass. Now what’s going on?!

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: (calm) You'll have to speak to my lawyer. We're done here. EXT. SEC OFFICES — DAY Terry and Allen walk into an impressive building with “Securities Exchange Commission” over it.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: So what does this place do?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: They’re cops for bankers. We should have come here to begin with.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Profession that needs it’s own cops. Fucking A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pan past a door with “Overseas Securities Division” on it and find Allen seated across from SEC Investigator DON BEAMAN, 54. Terry looks at framed college degrees.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: So you’re a law enforcement official?

dialogues.speaker: DON BEAMAN
dialogues.text: Yes, I’m hired by the Federal Government as a branch of the Federal Reserve.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: And the Federal Reserve is a... prison?

dialogues.speaker: DON BEAMAN
dialogues.text: Basically a bank owned by the Government that sets interest rates and gives loans to other banks. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: So, you investigate bankers involved in drugs and the sex trade?

dialogues.speaker: DON BEAMAN
dialogues.text: No, we investigate high level fraud, stock market manipulation, things of that nature.

dialogues.speaker: TERY
dialogues.text: Cold cases? Human trafficking?

dialogues.speaker: DON BEAMAN
dialogues.text: No. Now I was told you are both here regarding David Ershon?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Yes, what can you tell me about his business? Are there any on- going investigations, discrepancies, fraud, what not?

dialogues.speaker: DON BEAMAN
dialogues.text: Gentlemen let me put you at ease. David is an upstanding citizen. In fact I’m playing squash with him in forty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Is that when you’1l give hima hand job?

dialogues.speaker: DON BEAMAN
dialogues.text: Okay, I think we’re done here.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I guess you gotta get your hand cream ready for Ershon.

dialogues.speaker: DON BEAMAN
dialogues.text: I do not give him hand jobs!

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: My partner mispoke Mr. Beaman. I think he meant you both give each other hand jobs.

dialogues.speaker: DON BEAMAN
dialogues.text: The only time I have ever shared a bed with David Ershon was a whitewater rafting trip on the River Kern and no hand jobs were had by anybody!! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Listen to me you Windsor knot wearing monkey, you play squash with Ershon, your kids go to school with his, you tug on each other’s poles in the shower!! How do you know if he’s clean or not! Beat.

dialogues.speaker: DON BEAMAN
dialogues.text: Look, because you guys are concerned, I will go back and look at some stuff. Just to be sure.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: You do that champ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry and Allen walk up to their car and get in.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: That was nice, how’d you know that he’d turn like that?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I had no idea. Every now and then even a guy with no legs steps ina turd.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Is that a phrase?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, of course. A flatbed starts to back up to their car. TERRY (CONT’D) What the hell is this mook doing?

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC
dialogues.text: Just then, giant straps are thrown over the Prius by FOUR BLACK GUYS IN JUMPSUITS. It's a professional group, precise in their execution - the leader has a big fro and a nose piercing. THE CAR DOORS ARE STRAPPED SHUT.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Allen starts dialing his cell phone. One of the guys pulls out a DEMAGNIFICATION WAND. He waves it over the car. Allen’s phone, in mid conversation, goes dead.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: My phone is dead!

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Mine too. The car is then hooked up to the flatbed and hoisted up. Allen and Terry pound the doors, trying to get attention.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CITY STREETS- MINUTES LATER
dialogues.text: Terry and Allen are trapped in their car on the back of the flatbed being driving through Manhattan. They pound on the windows, scream and honk the horn. No one notices amidst all the street noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys still pound of the windows and yell but now with much less energy as they go through the Holland Tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allen and Terry both have their seats in recline while listening to the cast recording of MAMA MIA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry and Allen are both sound asleep as we see car lights strobing by in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry and Allen wake up to find themselves on top of giant freight train, flying parallel to route 66.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Motherfucker!  77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see railway WORKERS in the background who have just cut the straps off the car. Allen is in the foreground on a pay phone while Terry tips the workers.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: No, there weren’t any demands made and we weren’t mistreated. Basically they drove us to a freight train and then shipped us to Idaho. INT. D.A.’S SPECIAL UNIT OFFICES - SAME TIME The Lieutenant is on the phone in his office. Cut back and forth where necessary.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: Look guys if you want to do a road trip, take a weekend and go drinking. But don't play me for a sucker. Or was this about Ershon?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: (fast to get off phone) No we think it might be related to the cats. Anyway, we'll be back by morning depending on if we get this Continental flight out of Boise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allen and Terry are on a plane taxiing on the runway.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I told Sheila you thought she was hot by the way. She thought that was a weird thing to say toa friend about his wife.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I told you not to say that.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No you told me to tell her. I’m positive.  78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry and Allen sit with an African American SKETCH ARTIST, 34 in the crowded office. They drink coffee and look exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: That’s good, but the afro was bigger. That’s it....

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. And he had flaired nostrils.. and some jewelry his nose. Like ivory or a bone? The artist works and works.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bigger lips... Bigger. The artist holds up a rendering.

dialogues.speaker: SKETCH ARTIST
dialogues.text: So this is what your perp looked like? It's a police artist sketch of THE MOST OFFENSIVELY CARTOONISH LOOKING BLACK MAN EVER. Huge fro and a bone through the nose (sort of what the guy actually looked like).

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Yep. Yep. That’s him.

dialogues.speaker: SKETCH ARTIST
dialogues.text: You make me sick! To you, every black man is a criminal! We've got a black President! Open your damn minds! The artist storms off.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Joshua no! It’s really what he looked like! BOB walks by holding his cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Hey Guys, just wanted to talk to you about tomorrow, I got-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Jesus Bob, you have got to stop coming into conversations with this stupid shit! You’re boring and nobody wants to hear your worthless shit! Now go away!

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Jeez, guys. I just wanted to say I won’t be in to work tomorrow, cause the wife is really sick. They’re not sure if she’s going to make it. I’11 ahh.. pass on your love to her. Bob walks away.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Oh Bob! Bob! Come on Bob! Terry and Allen look at their desk. It’s covered in potatoes.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Next time you want potatoes, check your desk. Everyone laughs.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Really funny. (to the office) You know what! We’ve been kidnapped twice! Held at gun point! Car stolen! And no one has our backs! We’re police officers! We’re supposed to be on the same team! Does anyone remember that? The same team!

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: What case are you talking about, Terry?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: (caught, but same intensity) Nothing! Not a specific case! I mean, just in general! A lot of crazy stuff goes on in this world. I’m a peacock!

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Terry don’t. Not the peacock.  80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry and Allen walk to their cars. A Detective walks by.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Hey Allen, what time is that party tonight?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Party? There’s no party tonight.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Oh, right. The Detective walks away.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What was that about?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Nothing. Well, good night.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Okay, good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The apartment is decorated with streamers, balloons and filled with Detectives.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: (pacing and shouting) He doesn’t know anything! We've got him fooled!!

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Lower your voice sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: A lot of work has gone into this and, if we don't play this right, it's all for naught!!

dialogues.speaker: GUEST
dialogues.text: Lighten up Allen, it's just a surprise party.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: You know what? You lighten up!!

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Here he comes! Everyone hide. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They shut the lights off and hide. Terry jostles with the lock and finally he opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: Surprise!!!

dialogues.speaker: TERRY IMMEDIATELY ROLLS AND POPS UP ON A KNEE, GUN DRAWN
dialogues.text: and SHOOTING. Lamps and framed pictures explode as everyone runs screaming for cover. Terry throws a couple of road flares down. HE GETS ONE GUY IN A HEADLOCK AND ANOTHER GUY PINNED ON THE GROUND with his foot.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Drop your weapon!!! Everyone in the room has a gun pointed at Terry.

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. TERRY’S APARTMENT - THIRTY MINUTES LATER The party is now in full swing with people having cocktails and music playing.

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC
dialogues.text: Sheila and Allen talk to Terry.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: So I learned a lesson. Don’t have surprise parties for cops.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I told you I didn’t like birthdays.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: You didn’t even hesitate. Your gun was out immediately.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Always ready. Thanks for this though Allen, it’s not so bad... Allen holds up his Iphone and we hear the Morgan Freeman voice over app:

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN FREEMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And slowly the two partners grew closer as a lasting friendship was formed. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Put that away. So where’s all my furniture?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I put it on the roof. I had Evan from crime scene draw chalk outlines so we wouldn’t forget where it went. We see chalk outlines on the hardwood floor of a sofa, chair, TV stand etc.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: Hey guys, nice party. It’s Tim from the Apple store.

dialogues.speaker: TIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So I hooked up my Mosaic software to my Macbook pro and pumped that through my X-Box 360. No one will ever tell you this, then ran it through Ershon’s company’s hard drive...unnoticed! And got the last million keystrokes. Back tracked it and I found some dripping wet juicy stuff. Turns out his foreign banking clients bought about 90 billion from him in CDSRs. Credit default swap reverses.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What’s that? Smack?

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: No. How did you get that from what I just said? Anyway, Ershon sold several foreign banks Credit Default Swaps which are basically insurance that the reserves won’t fail, except you can sell and buy them. But he then adds a reverse which allows him to invest the default swaps with other banks. He created his own financial product. Made billions off of this.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: That’s fantastic work Tim.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: So any word on re-hiring? Things are pretty bad. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m working on the Geek Squad. I'm on call now, that's why I'm not drinking.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Sorry man.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: Hey, no one’s eating the chicken fingers, mind if I throw a sheet of tin foil over it and take it home?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: The party just started.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: I‘1l just stand by it and you give me the high sign when it’s okay to take it.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: You know, just take it now.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: Yeah, I thought that’s the way to go. He walks over and takes the chicken fingers and a big basket of nacho chips.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: So Ershon’s playing fast and loose with money he shouldn’t be playing fast and loose with? Allen is on his Iphone.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Seems like it... Armenian Reserve Bank, National Bank of San Paulo, National Bank of Chad...

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Armenians, Africans and South Americans.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: It seems like they’re not trying to kill him though.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: He was afraid of the Armenians. That’s for sure. SFX: THUNDER and RAIN kick up outside. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You put all my furniture on the roof and didn’t even check the weather?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: There are dozens of ways to answer that question but basically no, I didn’t check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pull up from the roof of the building where a full living room set is being rained on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry and Allen are sitting in the car across from Ershon’s building. Allen writes in a memo book.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: And what did Greg get you?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Williams Sonoma Pizza Brick.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Barry?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Hits of Motown Box Set.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: That’s thoughtful. You got some good gifts. A call comes over the radio.

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Possible Jumper. Three World Financial Center, 23rd floor. All units. Fire department and EMT en route.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: That’s Don Beaman’s office. Allen punches it and they tear off.  85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They’re tearing down the street. Terry puts in his ear wigs. Allen stops him.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Wait. I know we’ve got different tastes in music, but I really thought about your tastes and mine and I think I’ve got something we'll both like. Just please, give it at least a minute before you judge it. Allen pops in a CD. MUSIC: WALKING TO MEMPHIS by Marc Cohn. Immediately Terry ejects and throws it out the window. ALLEN (CONT’D) You know what you are? You’re petulant! Petulant!

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Don’t play that shit when we're working. It’s all I ask!

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: You ask for much more than that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry and Allen pull in front of the building. A crowd has gathered. They look up 23 floors sure enough, a figure is there. It's Don Beamen. A uniform cop is holding back a crowd.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Detectives Hoitz and Gamble! We got this!

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Hey, look! It’s the asshole who shot Jeter! It’s all yours.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I took a night course in negotiating at Hunter college. Give me the bullhorn. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: We don't have a bullhorn. Allen looks around and sees an ICE CREAM TRUCK surrounded by the onlookers. He runs towards it and reaches in grabbing the microphone for the speaker.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: This is police business. I need to use this PA system.

dialogues.speaker: ICE CREAM MAN
dialogues.text: Okay, let me turn it on. He turns it on and the PLUCKY CALLIOPE ICE CREAM TRUCK MUSIC automatically comes on.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Mr. Beamen! Mr. Don Beamen. We know you're in a really dark place right now. You’re feeling like the world is strangling you and sweet death is your only release. Are you wrong? Who can say? There’s a very good chance you kill yourself now, you’re greeted in heaven by an infinite number of open, loving arms. But think about life. All the great things. Sure there’s bad things, elderly people with no one to talk too, orphans who will never have a mother kiss them on the forehead. Innocent puppies that-

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: We got a second jumper on the fourteenth floor!

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What are you doing? You're starting to depress me!

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I'm creating a bond with the victim... (back to bullhorn) I’m not going to lie to you Don and that second person, who ever you are. People down here are murmuring that you don’t have the balls to do it. They’re saying that you’ll probably screw this up just like you screwed up your whole life. I say you can do it. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well I don’t mean “do it”, I just mean you have the capability.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Stop it man!

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Okay I went a little too far trying to get a bond.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: The guy on the 14th went back in.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Alright, now I’ve got some momentum. I find laughter to be very helpful on a gloomy day. One time there was this black comic on TV, and he was like “some women have big butts and they be showing it off, like, that’s right I got a big booty...Uh-huh!!” But he did it better than that- There's a crash. A body lands on the car next to Allen.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Nice job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There’s a body on a table. The CORONER, 38, is there with Terry and Allen.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Anything unusual in the toxicology? We’re pretty sure there’s foul play.

dialogues.speaker: CORONER
dialogues.text: This was a clear cut suicide. You can ask me all you want but that’s the answer. Lieutenant Mauch enters.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: Detectives, I believe you’re done here. Martin and Fosse were already investigating this man for cocaine and sex clubs. Martin and Fosse enter.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Hey guys. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FOSSE
dialogues.text: Meoooow. Terry and Allen are dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: I_said you're done here!!! Terry and Allen walk over to Mauch.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: We pulled this call!

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: You’re going to tell me you didn’t try to get the Examiner to connect this to Ershon?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: We asked....Yes. MUSIC SCORE: Grim cello. This is serious.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: I’ve got Senators calling the Mayor who’s calling the D.A. You've got zero political will on this. And I told you five times to lay off. But what did you do?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: We didn’t listen.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: You're being transferred. Terry, Traffic. Allen, Harbor Patrol. It’s already done so save your gas. The Lieutenant walks off leaving Terry and Allen devastated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry and Allen drive together in silence.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: The only thing I had to be proud of in my life was being a Detective. That was all I had.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: You still got me... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: You don’t get it do you? I don’t want you Allen! I never did. But I let myself forget and you dragged us into this bullshit! Credit swaps! SEC! Federal Reserve! Currency reserves! That’s not cop work!

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I can’t believe you still doubt me after everything we’ve seen. This case is real and I’m a real cop.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: You carry a wooden gun! You’re not a cop! You’re an accountant with a hot wife!!

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: How dare you call my wife hot!

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: We're done. Our job doesn’t mean we have to hang out anymore. Get out. Terry stops the car. Allen gets out.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was up front from day one that I didn’t like you.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Well I wasn’t honest about one thing.... I did like you. Allen walks away. Terry punches the accelerator and takes off.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I am acop. I AMA COP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. ALLEN’S HOUSE - DAY Allen sits at his kitchen table, he takes off his shirt REVEALING a T-SHIRT and drinking a beer. He throws his Iphone against the wall. Sheila, cooking at the oven, looks at him concerned.  90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry directs traffic in a blue police uniform with an orange reflective safety belt on. He’s defeated. INT. ALLEN’S HOUSE - DAY Allen is lifting weights and takes a swig of Jack Daniels. INT. TERRY’S APARTMENT —- NIGHT Terry sits in front of his computer. After a beat he goes to Google and types in “crime.” But then he deletes and types “Scaffolding violations.” A ton of hits come up and Terry leans in interested. EXT. PARK AVENUE - ERSHON’S HOUSE - DAY Terry, dressed like a construction worker, measures the scaffolding, takes notes, talks to a worker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN walks down the street. A PUNK runs by and grabs her purse and bolts. WE SEE ALLEN COME TEARING AROUND A CORNER IN SUNGLASSES AND LEATHER JACKET. But the Purse Snatcher is long gone. Allen hunches over breathing hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s a lecture hall. A bunch of Economics equations on the board and a professor lecturing. In the back of the room is Terry taking notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two PUNKS hold a gun at a DELI OWNER. They grab money from the register and run. ALLEN COMES RUNNING AFTER THEM. He chucks a garbage can lid at their feet, knocking them both over. In a flash he’s on them with punches to the face and a foot to the gun hand to separate weapon from perp. He cuffs them and radios in the bust.  91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry sits up front he raises his hand, answering a question. People start listening. INT. ALLEN’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Allen enters his bedroom wearing sunglasses and a leather coat. Sheila is there in a nightgown reading. Allen takes off his leather coat. He’s got a WIFE BEATER and a TATTOO.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: What’s happening to you Allen?!

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I became a cop. He grabs her and they kiss and make love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry is dressed as a Doctor in scrubs with a fake Mustache and glasses. An ORDERLY leaves the room and Terry rifles through a computer typing in “Donald Beaman.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allen walks into Lieutenant Mauch’s office. The Lieutenan is at his desk. Allen slams his wooden gun down.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I want my gun back. Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Gala. Terry runs up the steps in a tux.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s a black tie event in full swing -- band, champagne, furs. A WAITER passes by and Terry takes a glass of champagne and crosses over to Francine. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRANCINE
dialogues.text: Terry?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Shh. I’m not here to make a scene. I just wanted you to know I won’t be bothering you anymore and I’m sorry. A HANDSOME OLDER MAN walks over.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER MAN
dialogues.text: Francine, is this guy bothering you?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: You win, chief. You can have her. Enjoy making the sweet, sweet love to her that I dreamt about for years. But I swear to God, you make sure you pleasure her first before you cum, cause she’s an angel. She’s worth it.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCINE
dialogues.text: Terry, this is my dad. Terry puts in finger over her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Shhsssh. Please, let’s not try and hurt each other. Not now. Terry downs his champagne and heads out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allen stands at a gun bay. He’s wearing earphones. He draws his gun down on a target and empties it. He looks badass. He hit the switch and the target flies back to him. It’s unscathed.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Dammit. He sends the target back and reloads. Just as he starts to aim -- SIX RAPID FIRE SHOTS hit DEAD CENTER on his target. Allen leans forward to the next bay. It’s Terry.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Remember, bend your elbow. You get less recoil. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Hey. How’s traffic?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: It’s good. Been doing a little moonlighting too. Found out a lot about Ershon... and myself.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I guess I did the same. I got tired of pushing a computer mouse, decided to pick up some real metal. Grabbed my ol' .45.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: That’s a .38. (then) You were right. It's the scaffolding. That building had work completed a year ago, yet the scaffolds are still up. Landmarks approved work being done by a Brazilian company that’s owned by the bank doing business with Ershon.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I busted some guys stealing TVs, drank whiskey and made crazy great love to Sheila.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: And get this, I broke into the city morgue’s computer and found out that Don Beaman had half a bottle of gin in his system when he died. Beaman was AA for twenty years.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I feel like the things you did were more productive than what I did.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I doesn’t matter. What’s important is that we’ve got to bring in those Brazilians and Armenians for questioning and we can do it on the fake construction charge. Now we just gotta find them. WE HEAR GUNFIRE from the other stalls. They look to the left and see the BRAZILIAN MAN AND HOT LADY in two bays. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: More GUNFIRE, they look to their right and it’s the two ARMENIANS.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: There they are, right there. Everyone notices everyone else and reloads for a full harried beat. Terry is first and fires at the Brazilian Man. WE RIDE THE BULLET as it tears into the Brazilian Man’s shoulder, knocking him back.

dialogues.speaker: QUICK FLASH FORWARD
dialogues.text: The Brazilian Man is being treated by a Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: This is a nasty gun shot wound, how'd this happen?

dialogues.speaker: BRAZILIAN MAN
dialogues.text: It’s a tattoo accident... A bear bite...A BB gun wound.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: What? The Brazilian punches the Doctor, grabs medicine and runs. BACK TO ACTION. The Armenians run to the far side of the target range hiding behind targets. Allen ducks behind sand bags and fires at that, missing every time.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Cock your elbow! And don’t close one eye! (into his radio) We're at the Downtown Gun Club! Shots fired! I repeat shots fired!

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me? It’s a gun club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin and Fosse and other detectives listen to the dispatch. You can HEAR the gunfire. Everyone’s laughing.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Guys! Allen and Terry are reporting shots fired at a gun club.  95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hot Brazilian Lady and Terry exchange fire. She’s tough. She cart wheels behind a target and Terry hits it dead center four times but she’s already headed out the door.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Elbow cocked... both eyes opened... Allen squeezes off a shot at the Armenians and grazes one on the thigh. He grabs his wound and they scamper out of the range.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I got one! It’s suddenly quiet.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: You hear that? No sirens.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: They never sent back ups. There’s an eerie silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Mauch addresses.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: We got a big day out there. We got a full moon, people are going to be amped. Crazy town. What's on our HOT TIPs? We PULL BACK to see Lieutenant Mauch addressing the staff of TARGET. Teenagers and old men take notes.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Celine Dion Concert DVD drops today. We’re all excited, so are the customers. The Lieutenant see Terry and Allen standing in the back.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay everyone. Let's be careful out there. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: That was a rousing speech Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: Surprised to see you fellas. How's traffic and harbor patrol?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: We just came from getting shot at and no back ups came to the scene.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: You guys aren’t my problem anymore. The Lieutenant takes a price tag gun and begins pricing coffee makers.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Boss, we’re not making this up. Brazilian cartel soldiers are propping up Ershon while Armenian security forces try and take him out.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: From day one you were pushing us off this case. What’s going on Lieutenant? Is this an actual conspiracy?

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: (big breath) It’s worse than a conspiracy. You guys are caught in the most powerful force there is... He stops pricing the boxes.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Systemic indifference.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: Everyone has money with Ershon. The D.A., the Mayor, the whole upper east side. Everyone’s getting paid. They know they can’t openly obstruct your investigation so they ignore it to death. And it’s worse, cause not giving a shit leaves no prints. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: You said that cool.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: When I was in uniform, I got a tip about a Wall Streeter who was ripping off millions. Ended up being Ivan Boesky. I passed it off to the SEC. Nothing happened. Then I read he’s ripped off millions from people. I've put guys away for years for selling dime bags and this Boesky walked after 24 months. I've busted junkies, hookers, thieves and when all was said and done, I felt like they were just a hair on Andre the Giant’s left ball. Take this fucker down. But do it smart. Terry and Allen have got their blessing. It’s on.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Remember, you’ve got no support, no back up, no friends.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What else is new?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLO MO we see Terry and Allen rolling up to a stop in the Prius. Allen is taking pictures with his Iphone. Across the way we see a gourmet cheese shop.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I just don’t see how you can be so certain.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Ershon loves cheese and there's a 10 year aged French Gruyere that many people consider to be the finest in the world. This is the only place that carries it.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: So you think he’s going to show up to buy it? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I know he will. It’s only released every ten years and today’s the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bouzouki music plays, really loud. It's a small shop. Lots of wheels of cheese, lots of wooden boxes and cheese cloth and straw. There's a steady amount of customers.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: You’ve got to taste this one... Allen is tasting cheese and has a dozen sample napkins in front of him. ALLEN (CONT’D) It’s a Manchester Goat’s, washed rind and then go right into this Stilson. Perfection.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: You seem to know a lot about cheese.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Cheese has always been a passion of mine. Just then, David Ershon enters the store.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: Mr. Ershon!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID ERSHON
dialogues.text: Hello Gregory. Did it arrive? The Salesman takes out a velvet covered cask.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: This morning via private courier. He opens it up, it's the most beautiful piece of cheese ever. It looks like an ivory diamond. Ershon takes a big sniff. He's in ecstasy.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID ERSHON
dialogues.text: If the Mother Mary wore perfume.... Allen and Terry move in on each side of Ershon. Allen looks only at the cheese. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: That’s a nice hunk of cheese. Which country’s bank paid for that?

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: I wondered when you would return. Ershon gives the clerk his Amex black card.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, but is there a chance I could have a small taste of that?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: So is this what you do? You steal from poor countries so you can buy cheese?

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: This is not just “cheese.” This is the Saint Marjora Gruyere, made by blind celibate monks in the Basque region. Aged ten years in the tomb of Saint Ferdinand. They say every slice of cheese has ten tears the monks shed for the flowers they will never see. This single piece of cheese cost more that you make in a whole year. Terry and Ershon stare each other down.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Can I have a piece?

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: No. You may not. Now if you’ll excuse me, I believe I asked you to speak to my lawyers. Ershon signs the credit card slip and exits the store with Terry and Allen behind him.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Please can I have a taste of that cheese?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exit the store and walk down the street. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Don Beamen didn't commit suicide. You know that. What did he find? Ershon stops and wheels on Terry.

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: Don Beamen is a good friend of mine, I don't appreciate you using his name!!

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Look, we're all upset. Let’s just sit down, have some of that cheese and figure this all out!

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Allen, shut up about the cheese! A CARGO VAN pulls up. The three Armenians jump out. They make their way to the Ershon. David Ershon runs. Terry and Allen follow.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why are you running from these men? Just tell us! Allen slows and bends over.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I’m cramping up. Too much cheese. Terry grabs Ershon by the neck.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Just get him in our car. I’m in the mood for a fight. Allen leads Ershon to the Prius. The Armenians rush at Terry who stands there calmly. Terry PUNCHES one in the throat, KNOCKS a TELESCOPING ROD out of another’s hand and breaks his wrist with it. QUICK FLASH CUT: An X-RAY of a horribly broken wrist. CUT BACK TO REAL TIME: Terry kicks the third guy into traffic where he is hit by a passing car.

dialogues.speaker: QUICK FLASH CUT
dialogues.text: Six months later. The Tall Armenian drives a cab. He’s got a FAMILY of TOURISTS.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: So, how’d you become a cab driver? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TALL ARMENIAN
dialogues.text: I used to kill people, then I hurt my hip. I take the FDR, okay? CUT BACK TO REAL TIME: Terry kicks the last guy in the stomach and punches the last guy with a nasty right hook in the mouth where he knocks out several teeth.

dialogues.speaker: QUICK FLASH CUT
dialogues.text: Armenian Number 3 is on a date with a CUTE GIRL.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE GIRL
dialogues.text: I like you. You make me feel safe. He smiles to reveal the worst fake teeth ever.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE GIRL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Excuse me, I’m going to go. CUT BACK TO REAL TIME: Terry runs over and jumps in the car where Allen and Ershon are.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: How do you do that?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Don’t freak out and keep your left up. Allen punches the accelerator and they pull out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Prius pulls out we see four MOTORCYCLISTS on low riding black Mercedes bikes. It’s the AFRICANS. One of them has a sawed off shotgun. He fires at the car ripping through the back window.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Who are these people shooting at? You or us?

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: I don’t know!! Allen skids to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Okay, let’s find out. Terry hangs Ershon half out of the car. He looks down the street and sees the four Motorcyclists tearing at him. A shotgun blasts at Ershon. Ershon panics. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: I invest money for foreign banks and I had some losses so I covered them with illegal money transfers from other banks and then I lost it all!! Terry pulls Ershon in and Allen hits the Prius in reverse KNOCKING ONE MOTORCYCLIST OFF HIS BIKE with the open passenger door.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Why are some of these groups propping you up if you ripped them off?

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: Honestly, I do not know! Allen slams on the brakes. Terry pushes Ershon out. Allen puts it into park and turns on the radio. MUSIC: PHIL COLLINS’ You Can’t Hurry Love.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: We haven't had our lunch break yet Terry.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: No we haven't Allen. Allen kicks up his feet and opens up Ershon’s cheese and has a bite. The Motorcyclists rocket towards them firing shots.

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: If it comes out that I bankrupted the banks their whole economies will collapse. So they’re propping me up until I can set deals with other countries or they can set up something with the IMF.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Is the IMF a street gang?

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: No! The International Monetary Fund. The basically buy messed up countries! Now give me my fucking cheese. Terry pulls him back in and Allen hits the pedal. Ershon snatches the cheese back from Allen. Allen leans in and takes one more bite. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Ooohhhh. Soo good... Allen cruises through a parking lot. The three motorcyclists are still behind him. ALLEN (CONT’D) I can’t lose them. The door was the only driving trick I knew.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Listen to me. You’re gonna turn here and then left on Lex. The side window is shot out. The Motorcyclists are all over them.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now cut the wheel to the right.... Now! Allen turns and there are literally 80 MOTORCYCLISTS parked in the middle of the street hanging around.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: What the-!

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I Twittered a Motorcycle challenge. Said me and my buddies are the fastest and who wants a challenge. As they pass through all the bikes follow the three Motorcycles causing a giant pile up. Allen tears off leaving them behind.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I can’t believe you Tweeted! Was that your first?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I guess.

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: There’s many more people looking for me. We’re not safe.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: We got no back up. We need time to figure out what to do.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: There’s a safe house two blocks from here. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I did the paperwork on the new hot water heater they put in. They use it for mafia witnesses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their car screeches to a stop in front of a brownstone. It has a FORECLOSED notice on the door and a REAL ESTATE QUICK SALE SIGN ON THE BRICK FACE.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: They didn’t pay the mortgage on the safe house?

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: I have a small apartment I use for private affairs. No one knows about it. Go to 93rd and 2nd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a vast amazing space taking up the whole floor, sparsely decorated, 360 views, terraces light up.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: This is your second apartment?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID ERSHON
dialogues.text: My third in New York.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: (not impressed) Wow. How impressive. You’ve got lotsa fancy apartments. Sit down dick. Terry pushes Ershon onto a chair. A butler DEMARCO, 50, enters.

dialogues.speaker: DEMARCO
dialogues.text: Is everything okay Mr. Ershon?

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: Yes, Demarco. Everything is fine. This is Demarco. He cares for the place and cooks.  105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stroll around the apartment looking at original Warhol’s and Pollacks.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: This really is an amazing place. What’s sad is you probably start taking it for granted after a month or two.

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: If you like it, it’s yours.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: If you let me walk out of here, I'll have my lawyers draw up some documents so that no one will ever know how you got it and I'll disappear.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Drop dead.

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: How about the apartment plus two hundred million in an untraceable off shore account?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: We said no!

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Are we tempted? Yes! But the answer is no!

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: One billion dollars. Off shore account. There is a beat of silence.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Terry, can we talk? Terry and Allen step away. They talk very close to each other. (CONTINUED)
ALLEN (CONT’D) One billion dollars! And we know he has the money. We have a moral obligation to think about this.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Are you crazy? There's no argument. We definitely take this money. It’s a billion fucking dollars!

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: It's tempting. It really is. I always wanted to open a hospital for the sick kids.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Right now, I want to cry that is so amazing. I can't believe I didn't know that!

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: When I was kid, I was sickly. I've never told anyone that.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: David, we'll be with you in a moment. We’re just hashing out some details!

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: You know what I just thought of, so it doesn’t seem so wrong? We fund a department for the police force that trains officers to resist bribes.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: That’s good. That way, yes, this is wrong. But a greater good comes from it.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Wait, wait, wait.... Everyone will wonder where the money came from!

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: David! Won’t everyone wonder where the money came from?!

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: Believe me, if there’s one thing I know how to do it’s hide money. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then you decide if you want to leave the country or just take small amounts out for the next seventy years. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: That’s good enough for me. Terry and Allen walk towards Ershon with hands extended for a big handshake and a hug.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Done deal!

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: You guys have made a wise decision.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: It feels great. A little wrong. But great. Demarco pops a bottle of champagne. They all toast. INT. LOFT —- TWENTY MINUTES LATER The fax machine is ringing off the hook. Pages are coming forward. Terry, Allen and Ershon are huddled over a desk looking at paper work and still sipping champagne.

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: Here are passports under aliases for accessing the money.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Thank you very much.

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: And now just a signature here. They both sign.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: This is so great. Where do you go from here David?

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: I actually made a deal with the Chinese government. I bring tens of billions into their economy and they give me residence with no extradition. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: That’s a very smart deal. Very smart. Ershon press the conference button on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: Let’s go around the horn to see who’s on the call once again. We hear voices on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: LAWYER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is Evan Riefle from Riefle and Taback.

dialogues.speaker: LAWYER
dialogues.text: This is Eileen Shapp from Gerland, Shapp and Quentin.

dialogues.speaker: FOREIGN BANKER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is Rudolpho Mirici from the First Bank of Venice.

dialogues.speaker: FOREIGN BANKER
dialogues.text: This is Dmetri Wirkin from-

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Wait! No... I can’t do it!

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Thank God. I can’t do it either.

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Absolutely. I could never live with myself. My whole life would seem corrupt.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Sorry everyone.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Eileen, Evan, Rudolpho... Dmitri. Thank you for all of your work. But the deal’s off. Ershon hangs up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry and Ershon in

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I immediately feel better. But now that it sinks in that we just passed on a billion dollars, I feel sick.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I have an idea that could make us feel better...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allen are inside a stunning wine room with tow.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: What’s the most expensive bottle of wine you have? We may not be taking your bribe but we can at least live like you for one night.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I love it.

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: This 98’ Napa Valley Shiraz is quite good.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Bullshit. Go for the oldest bottles at the end.

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC
dialogues.text: QUICK CUT; Allen on the Remember when Angus for our I make up for QUICK CUT; Terry on the

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: phone.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I took you to Black anniversary? Tonight it. phone.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Just for tonight. No professing my love for you. No talking to you about us getting married. Just us.  110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allen walks back and forth while DeMarco takes notes in the amazing kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: For dinner, kobe beef skewers with foie gras, lobster, taken out of the shell, potato with black truffles and for dessert, the gold leaf cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Terry locking Ershon into a guest bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Nighty night creep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys stand in the mirror in designer tuxedos.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: You believe this guy keeps tuxes for his guests? The doorbell rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful dinner. Allen pours a glass of wine, Sheila sips it

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Wow, it almost evaporates on your tongue.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Please, it’s not Hic. That’s a forty thousand dollar bottle of wine according to my wine appraisal app.

dialogues.speaker: DEMARCO
dialogues.text: Kobe beef skewers with humanely gathered foie gras. Enjoy.  111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francine sits with Terry.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCINE
dialogues.text: I can’t believe I’m saying this. But when you walked away and said you would never contact me again, I got a little sad.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Yeah. It was hard from my end too.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCINE
dialogues.text: I have missed you Terry. You were my first boyfriend. Francine goes up to him -- they’re close for the first time in twenty years. Terry is dizzy. DeMarco walks in carrying a tray.

dialogues.speaker: DEMARCO
dialogues.text: Gold leaf- (he stops) Francine? Is this guy bothering you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheila is now just in her bra. She and Allen are kissing.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: You know I love you honey. But we got to talk about some stuff that's really been eating at me.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Sure. Whatever. Sheila stands there, beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I feel like you've let yourself go. I feel like when we started dating, you we're the good looking one and now, it's changed and I'm the good looking one. I guess that's what those vows mean.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: What are you saying? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I just don't want us to walk into a room and have people go, wow, look at those two. I wonder if she trapped him.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Look I'm sorry, I've been so selfish in the last year. Like when I said let's experiment with a threesome or when I said take a year off from work and I'll support us.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: You have been really, really selfish. And honestly, physically you look gross. But here’s what is amazing about us -- this conversation opens my eyes to why I love you. Your inner beauty.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ershon sits in his room and types into his computer in Chinese characters. The computer screen: CHINA AIR. He switches screens and goes to a KIDS PARTY PLANNER. Ershon picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: I wanted to inquire about a bouncy castle for tomorrow morning... INT. LOFT —- DAY Terry and Allen stumble into the kitchen. DeMarco pours them fresh orange juice. Sheila's up, reading the paper.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Morning. Terry grabs a cup of coffee. Francine runs through, rushed.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCINE
dialogues.text: I had an amazing time. But now I’m late for ballet. She gives Terry a kiss and leaves. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Allen walks over to Ershon’s room.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Ershon, you want some of your food? Allen opens the door. He sees Ershon STANDING on the WINDOW LEDGE about to JUMP.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: David, no! Don’t kill yourself and go to heaven where you’1l be showered with love for eternity! Allen moves towards Ershon just as he lets himself fall.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Noooo! Terry runs over. ALLEN (CONT’D) The sonofbitch jumped. Terry and Allen look over the edge to see a BOUNCY CASTLE perfectly placed to break his fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ershon climbs off the bouncy castle. There's a man dressed as a PRINCE. He watches Ershon run by

dialogues.speaker: PRINCE
dialogues.text: Hey dude, where are the kids? Ershon jumps into a waiting car.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Where is he going? Allen walks over to the desk phone and hits redial.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: (in Chinese) Air China.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: He’s flying Air China. That’s JFK. Allen works his iPhone. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Flight Tracker!

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Stop saying out loud what thing you’re using on your IPhone! Just do it! Allen scans it.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Next international flight in two hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ERSHON’s SUV heads down the Westside Highway. A SUV PULLS in BEHIND them. Then ANOTHER SUV. Window are rolled down REVEALING the Armenians in one and the Africans in the other. They all carry Tech-Nines. The three cars star jockeying for position heading down the Westside Highway. They exchange gunfire - windows are blown out. Cabs skid out of the way. Terry and Allen's car swings in behind them. The Foursome tear down the Westside Highway. INT. TERRY’S CAR - DAY Terry drives. Allen is on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: (into radio) Heading down tenth. Be ready for booking and processing, have a big stack of paperwork ready -- 8 by 11, laser jet 24 pound stock, 94 brightness. Terry pulls out a CD and puts it in the player. They shout their conversation of the engine noise.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I got to thinking, sure we have different types of music. But sometimes when you put two types of music together. They become better and stronger. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: You mean like a team?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I thought what I said, said it without being too heavy handed. The way you said it made me feel queesy! Allen hits play. IT’S A MASH-UP BETWEEN LITTLE RIVER BAND AND METALLICA -- it kicks hard.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: It’s our time! Get out of the way! Immediately, the Brazilians are behind them. The hot Brazilian blows Allen a kiss and then they RAM the Prius. Terry and Allen’s car spins out of control toward a truck with two SKATER DUDES UNLOADING A SKATE BOARD RAMP. The skaters see Terry and Allen’s car careening for them. They drop the ramp and jump away. IN SLO MO we see the car drive right up the ramp and flip over, landing on their roof. Hard.

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC OUT
dialogues.text: From Terry and Allen's UPSIDE DOWN POV -- they watch as the Brazilians, Armenians, Africans, cop cars and Ershon all tear off into the distance.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I feel like they have all the cool guns, all the cool cars and we get our asses handed to us every time. Terry and Allen climb out of the car. Terry looks over at the Javitt’s Convention Center. On the front sign it reads “XXX ADULT CONVENTION, KNIFE AND GUN SHOW, AND CAR AND MOTORCYCLE SHOW.”

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Let’s get to a wireless connection and cancel Ershon’s airplane reservation. Terry runs over to the Javitt’s Center.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey! Wait up!  116. EXT. JAVETT’S CONVENTION CENTER - DAY Terry COMES SMASHING THROUGH THE MAIN WINDOW on a crazy SPIDER THREE WHEELED MOTORCYCLE with a pump action shot gun with a laser scope on it and PORN STAR BRIANNA BANKS SITTING ON THE BACK.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: That’s more like it. After a beat Allen comes tearing around from the back in a TESLA SPORTS CAR with a SHOCK GRENADE GUN.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ms. Banks, I love your films, you got to get off.

dialogues.speaker: BRIANNA BANKS
dialogues.text: That was fun! Bye! They both gun it and tear down town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lieutenant is MASSAGING A MIDDLE AGED WOMAN in a day spa.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: (answers phone) Yeah this is him. Sweet Christ. A high speed chase with shots fired? I'll be right in. He storms off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin is over Fosse’s shoulder studying a computer screen (unseen).

dialogues.speaker: FOSSE
dialogues.text: From the hair, I'd say 1995ish.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: I’m going with brazilian wax.

dialogues.speaker: FOSSE
dialogues.text: Landing strip. Fosse hits a button. They both scream with glee. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FOSSE/MARTIN
dialogues.text: Clean shaven! I love this site.

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: .--Multiple cars involved in high speed chase... Shots fired....

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Let’s go!

dialogues.speaker: FOSSE
dialogues.text: One more. One more. They both go back to the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: News choppers jam the skyline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ershon barrelling down the street while being shot up by gun men in the two SUVs. Suddenly the back tire of the Armenian SUV blows up and Terry comes rocketing up on his bike with his sighted shot gun. The Armenian SUV is then rammed and we see Allen in his Tesla. We see BRAZILIAN HOT LADY AND TOUGH GUY in the front seat. It's chaos set to cranking music. Terry and Allen talk to each via Bluetooths.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: We’ve got to ram them down University and tenth and through Washington Square. If I’ve got my date and time correct, they’ve got a little treat.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Wow. That helmet has built in blue tooth? I’m hands free!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New York Police Academy Cadet Graduation services are in progress. A HIGH RANKING OFFICER is talking to a sea of new Cadets and their proud parents. In the background we hear SIRENS, HORNS, CRASHING. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: POLICE CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: You are now part of a tradition built on tolerance and a firm belief that everyone is innocent and protected until proven guilty. Just then, Ershon's car crashes through the back of the stage. Immediately following are the SUVs, Terry's motorcycle, Allen's Tesla. The Squad Cars chasing another SUV. Two of SUVs crash off the stage and come to an abrupt stop.

dialogues.speaker: CADETS
dialogues.text: Get’em! / My first collar! All the cadets descend on the security forces in the SUVs. They BEAT THE CRAP out of the Armenians and the Africans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry comes upon the SUV and Ershon pulling up to the West side Helipad. A CHOPPER IS WAITING.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: He’s taking a chopper!!! Allen comes barrelling around a corner and comes screaming up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're seconds too late. Ershon is GETTING IN the HELICOPTER. The Brazilians are pulling up. The Helicopter's blades spin, Ershon climbs in. Allen drives his Tesla, skids to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: He must have a private plane in Jersey! We’ve lost him!

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
