dialogues.text: The hell with that.... Terry takes off his helmet, watches in disgust. He looks at Allen's car, perfectly positioned. TIGHT on Terry's eyes. TIGHT on Allen's eyes. TIGHT on Terry as he nods ‘yes'. TIGHT on Allen as he nods 'no'. Terry puts back on his helmet and revs the throttle.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Nol!!! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Terry locks the brake as the back tires burn rubber and then pops the clutch. Allen's eyes grow huge as Terry full speed comes right at him. At the last millisecond, TERRY POPS A WHEELIE USING the TESLA like a RAMP, shooting himself in to the air. Terry in SLO MO sails toward the rising helicopter. COPS, ALLEN, BAD GUYS all stare, frozen. Terry sails, separating from his bike. With one hand he cocks his shot gun, the other, he reaches for the door to the helicopter. It's poetry. Then in REAL TIME, TERRY SLAMS HEAD FIRST INTO THE HELICOPTER GLASS AND FALLS FORTY FEET to the water. ALLEN (CONT’D) Nooo!!!! Allen dives into the water. In the background we see the helicopter corkscrew from the impact and fall into the water with a huge violent splash. Police Cars pull in and block the Brazilian’s van from leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harbor Patrol boats circle the helicopter. ALLEN AND TERRY STAND WET WITH BLANKETS BY THE EDGE OF THE PIER. Uniformed police lead away the Brazilians. As they pass Terry and Allen THE HOT BRAZILIAN LADY BREAKS AWAY AND KISSES ALLEN.

dialogues.speaker: HOT BRAZILIAN LADY
dialogues.text: (in Portuguese) I will meet you in Rio in twenty years. The police pull her away and towards the Paddy Wagon.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Come on man, what is with you and the ladies?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Don’t freak out and always picture them on the toilet when you talk to them. Ershon is handed over to Terry and Allen.

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: You got me. I guess even a man with no legs sometimes steps in a turd. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I told you that was a phrase. Cuff him Allen. Allen puts cuffs on Ershon.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: You have the right to remain silent. Anything you say can and will be used against you ina court of law. You have the right to... We pull out as rights are read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. CITY HALL MEETING ROOM —- CONTINUOUS The Mayor, the D.A., Allen, Terry, Lieutenant Mauch and two SEC OFFICIALS sit at a large conference table. Ershon sits at the far end of the table with handcuffs on.

dialogues.speaker: SEC OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Ershon is tied to a dozen international banks not to mention at least five major domestic banks that have received bailout funds are finally showing signs of recovery. D.A. We know this is a mess. A lot of us in the room will suffer losses as well.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: First and foremost, David, what happened to the god damn money?

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: David you asshole! I’m Godfather to your son! I know you. You’re a meticulous prick! Where is it!?

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: It’s on my Facebook Page. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: D.A.
dialogues.text: What? Allen clicks on Facebook. It shows on a large screen.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: There’s a lot of data on this page. Sorry for the delay. We see the spinning pin wheel on the screen. Everyone waits. ALLEN (CONT’D) (singing to kill time) SPINNING WHEEL...SPINNING ROUND...

dialogues.speaker: D.A.
dialogues.text: Stop it Detective. The pin wheel stops. Everyone leans in. TIGHT ON SCREEN we see it’s a Facebook Page for David E. There’s one video imbed which Allen clicks on. The beginning of Rob Schneider’s CHICK MAGNET starts. Rob Schneider wears a big pimp hat and spills a drink on a women’s breasts.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: What the hell is this?

dialogues.speaker: ERSHON
dialogues.text: The bulk of the money was lost once currencies began to fall. The rest was invested in German Health Care funds, they then invested the money into derivatives, which we're bought by China, who turned around and bought baskets of mortgages, that money was turned around and invested in a film production company which at some point last year, shot “Chick Magnet.” And that is all that’s left.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: 80 billion dollars gone. Sweet Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: I saw that movie. It was funny. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We see that Bob is in the room too with a cup of coffee. D.A. God bless America. Another SEC Official walks in and hands papers to Official #1.

dialogues.speaker: SEC OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: More bad news. Our lawyers have been pouring over the charges against Ershon and because of a bill passed in ‘01 concerning international banking regulations, technically speaking David Ershon hasn’t done anything illegal.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: You gotta be kidding me! I never heard about that bill!

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: I did. Page 22 section D bottom right column of the Times. Plus C Span mentioned it. Ershon stands up and SEC Official #2 unlocks his handcuffs.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Wait! Allen puts a bunch of paper work on the table.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ve been filing evidence and writing reports during my down time on this case... He starts pushing forward immaculate files.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ....Offering an officer of the law a bribe....Fleeing and evading arrest....Failure to comply....And Of course: violation of the public hazard act by failing to get a proper permit for scaffolding. The D.A. looks at the paperwork. D.A. He’1ll do ninety days, tops. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT MAUCH
dialogues.text: Don’t listen to these hacks Detectives. This is the closest they’ve been to doing the right thing in years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry and Allen exit and walk down the steps. There is no press conference. But across the way Martin and Fosse stand in front of three dozen reporters.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: When did you realize that Brazilian terrorists were in the city?

dialogues.speaker: FOSSE
dialogues.text: It’s really something you just know in your bones....

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I can’t believe we traded ninety days and failure to file a permit for Brazilian terrorists.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: I’m fine with it.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Yeah.... screw career.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry and Allen sit on the fountains on Sixth Avenue and 5lst eating gyros. A STRANGE GUY walks up them in silhouette from the sun.

dialogues.speaker: STRANGE GUY
dialogues.text: Okay here’s the deal. You think you broke this open? You did nothing. If anything busting a guy like Ershon gives people a sense that nothing’s going on. But right now there’s fifty lobbyists out there pounding Washington, stripping out every form of regulation so that guys like Ershon can run wild. You didn’t land the big fish, you just spanked a guppy. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What the Hell? The Strange Guys steps out of the sun, it’s DEREK JETER.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Derek Jeter?

dialogues.speaker: DEREK JETER
dialogues.text: Terry, you were set up that night you shot me. There were no threats and they knew putting a quick trigger finger like you by that door where I always take a pre-game Ipod walk would turn out bad for me. I’d been doing my own investigation on Ershon. I tried to talk to people, no one listened. And that’s when they sent you. It shut me up. It shut me up for years, until I saw what you guys did. I forgive you Terry.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Wow. I can’t believe it was a set up. I’m so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK JETER
dialogues.text: The whole system’s dirty with big money. You guys aren’t the only one’s who love this city. There are others. But start here. Derek hands them a folder.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK JETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A guy by the name of Carl Bastion, CEO of MacroBank. He took three billion in TARP funds, but refuses to give documentation on how he spent it. Take him down. But be careful, this guy’s got Blackwater mercenaries on the clock 24/7. Derek walks off feeding pigeons like a street person. INT. TERRY’S CAR - DAY MUSIC UP: Pink Floyd’s, “Money” covered by Mos Def. They’re driving off in the battered Tesla, heading down the Westside Highway towards Wall Street. Allen reads the file. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: This guy Bastion is nasty. He summers with Dick Cheney. You’re going to have to teach me to shoot and fight like you.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Now, you’re just blowing smoke up my ass.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Please don’t say that. It’s disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: How is that disgusting?

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Why would blowing smoke up someone’s ass be a good thing?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: It’s a figure of speech.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: It’s deranged. What kind of a pervert introduced that into the language? By definition the smoke is second hand, equally as dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: I’ve never understood kissing ass as a phrase. The only person I want kissing my ass is your wife.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN
dialogues.text: Alright, you just crossed the line.
